Job Description:
We're looking for a Software Developer to join our team! If the description below describes you, and you're passionate about software development, teamwork and continuous learning, then consider applying for this position! We are looking for both local candidates and also remote candidates.

What You'll Do:

The Software Developer will:
Work within a cross-functional project team to develop Interactive Response Technology (IRT) for randomization and drug supply management
Review user requirements specifications, verifying that all requirements can be implemented with the Suvoda software in the required timeframe
Assist with the creation of implementation design and technical design documentation
Develop software systems that are reliable, maintainable, and efficient, with emphasis on patient safety and integrity of clinical study data
Manage the deployment of Suvoda IRT systems into all environments, completing all required documentation
Assist the support team with troubleshooting and resolution of issues reported on production systems
Participate in the product research and development process by providing the engineering team with new solutions and ideas based on project experience
Generate ideas for innovative technological solutions to increase the quality of Suvoda systems
Perform other related duties as required
Who You Are:

You have:
A Bachelor's degree
Prior working experience with C#, .NET, and SQL Server (3-5 years desired)
Familiarity with Web-Services, Enterprise Service Bus, Model View Controller (MVC) and Entity
Experience with Framework (EF) a plus
A high achieving personality
Desire to learn and grow
Strong work ethic
Sense of ownership
A proactive attitude
Time management and organizational skills
Attention to detail
Who We Are:

Suvoda is a group of exceptionally bright, passionate and curious employees working together to solve complex challenges for our clients using our best-of-breed IRT system. It's really as simple as that. We are the trusted technology partner that enables health sciences organizations (like pharma companies and biotech firms) to execute their clinical trials while remaining focused on what's most important, their patients. Headquartered in the greater Philadelphia area, with offices in Bucharest, Barcelona and Portland, OR, we've experienced impressive year-over-year growth and are growing our teams across the globe. Learn more about us on our website!

What You'll Get:

In addition to working with a group of super-smart colleagues who work as hard as they play, you'll get:
Competitive Compensation
Medical, Dental and Vision coverage (on your first day!)
401(k) with company match
30+ days of PTO (plus sick time and professional flexibility)
Paid parental leave
Training and professional development
Company-sponsored events

Cinder is looking for a *Software Engineer* to fill a role for our client in *Hillsboro, OR*. This is a *full time, 40 hour per week o*pportunity with a full benefits package that includes PTO!
Responsibilities include but are not limited to: *
Developing new telemetry application features within Microsoft WCOS operating system
Contributing to feature design and development alongside engineers and validation team members
Researching and investigating driven through experiments, then evolving into product development by engineers
Validating for quality, security, and compatibility with Microsoft WCOS OS
Required Skills: *
3+ years of experience with Windows system developer
Experience with C and C++
Experience debugging and writing software for Windows internals (kernel, etc.)
Hands on experience with new Microsoft WCOS/Win10x operating system
Experience with driver development and installer package development
Work Environment: *
Must work onsite in Hillsboro, OR.
Shift: Normal work hours
Pay Rate: $35-38/hour depending on experience
If you are looking for a professional, challenging, stimulating environment and meet the above criteria, please apply now!!
Candidate must thrive in a diverse environment and commit to maintaining an inclusive work environment for coworkers of all races, genders, orientations, and abilities. We believe that different life experiences and perspectives are what make the strongest teams. While we are happy to provide any available training or guidance to help sharpen your skills, your success with Cinder requires the ability to work well with a variety of people.
We are unable to sponsor at this time. No third-party candidates considered for this position.

Schedule:
Monday to Friday

Location:
Hillsboro, OR (Preferred)

Essential Functions:

§ Responsible for the development and maintenance of all systems including but not limited to:

Corporate website currently based on ASP, ASP.NET(C#), MVC/MS SQL Server

Mobile apps, iOS (Swift and XCode) and Android (Java and Android Studio)

§ Development of additional internal application development projects as directed

§ Provide regular reports to manager as directed regarding assigned projects

§ Act as a strong and consistent contributor to the Application Development team

§ Keep abreast of applicable industry software developments

§ Participate in development planning and prioritization activities

§ Assist the QA department to perform QA developer roles and responsibilities

This position offers working from home with the exception of one day a week working in the coporate office. We are a close knit team who enjoys working for our company who offers us great benefits -including employer paid medical and an amazing 401K match. Our average tenure for employees is 8 years which means we are doing something right!

Why Smarsh?
Our motto is ‘People First. Inspire Confidence. Embrace the Impossible.’ We hire lifelong learners who have a passion for their discipline and a track record of excellence. To learn more about us, visit www.smarsh.com In our space, Gartner has placed us a leader for 4 consecutive years. We are the right size for effective software engineering, not too small and not too big. Your contributions will be noticed, you will matter, and you will be part of a team that wants to succeed.
From day one, Smarsh was built on a set of core values that have motivated and sustained us – People First, Inspire Confidence, and Embrace the Impossible. We ask that each of our employees – whether new or old- ingrain these values in our day-to-day decisions, call on them while serving our customers and our peers and apply them when creating the best possible products we can imagine.
Together—as one team—we listen, collaborate and believe that anything and everything is possible.

Company Description
Smarsh is the leader in communications compliance, archiving, and analytics. We provide compliance across the broadest set of communications channels with insights on what’s being captured. Smarsh customers manage over 500 million daily conversations across 80 channels and growing. Customers include the top 10 U.S., top 8 European, top 5 Canadian, and top 3 Asian banks. The Smarsh advantage is customers stay ahead of compliance and uncover patterns and relationships hidden within their data.
At Smarsh, we’ve been helping our customers manage new forms of communication since 2001. We work closely with regulators including the SEC, FINRA, IIROC, and the PRA and FCA, and with our customers, to ensure that they understand the capabilities of today’s technology and that our platform meets their most stringent requirements. Our products include Connected Capture, Connected Archive, Web Archive, Business Solutions, & Federal Arch

Job Description: Lead Software Engineer
We are currently looking for a strong, experienced Lead Software Engineer to join our team. You will have the opportunity to work on all aspects of the product. We already have a phenomenal product running in our data centers and as a member of this team, you will have the opportunity to bring that product to life running in a public cloud. This is the perfect position for someone that thrives on solving difficult problems, making iterative improvements toward a goal, and working on high visibility engineering projects.
Responsibilities
Build high performance, highly available, applications in the cloud
Migrate existing on-premise applications to the cloud
Work closely with our product managers to understand product needs
Write & test code that truly works— code that is elegant & scales well
Focus on fast, iterative & agile development
Ensure performance, scalability, availability & security in everything you do
Contribute to platform-level technology, strategy & decisions
Mentor junior developers
Engage in the business goals as well as the technology
Requirements

7+ years of development experience
Proficient with Java, C#, and .NET (proficient with at least 1)
Passionate about code craftsmanship, writing maintainable code, and following best practice standards
Enjoy working in a AWS cloud-native environment.
Believe in true DevOps; Developers write code, test code, deploy code, monitor and support code in production.
Value automated testing and CI/CD.
Proficient with declarative IaC frameworks: Terraform or CloudFormation
Must embrace Quality Up Front principles, TDD, and frequent iterations.
Comfortable working in a small, dynamic, and fast-paced team
Resourceful, flexible & adaptable; no task is too big or too small
Knowledge of data structures and algorithms, time complexity, and space complexity
Proven ability to learn new technology quickly and proficiently
Solid understanding of modern front-end frameworks and libraries (Vue.js, React)
Preferred Skills
Knowledge of functional programming concepts and programming languages: Python or NodeJS/TypeScript
Experience with Azure cloud services
Familiar with NoSQL database concepts
Experience with Serverless services such as Lambda, DynamoDb, and Kinesis.

What will you contribute?

The Software Developer will be working on new and existing components supporting lending applications and report to a Senior Manager of Software Development. This position is located at one of our leading development sites in Downtown Portland, Oregon.

Responsibilities & Deliverables:

Your responsibilities as a Software Developer will include, but are not limited to, the following:
Translate business requirements into well-architected solutions that best leverage the existing code base, and development processes.
Contribute to software designs
Develop high-quality code and test scenarios
Readily comprehend user needs and grasp technical implications
Test, debug, analyze and remedy application problems. Work closely with stakeholders to efficiently fix issues
Follow our software development lifecycle
Interact with internal stakeholders to support releases


Required Experience:
Minimum of 5 years combined strong experience of development in C#, C++
Strong technical, analytical, and development skills
Familiarity with software development methodologies and the software development lifecycle
Be comfortable with modern software development lifecycle best practices including agile and SAFe development, delivering working software frequently with attention to technical excellence
Ability to research & discuss solutions to a variety of technical problems of moderate scope and complexity -- over time, independently
Effective verbal and written communication skills and a customer orientation
Collaborate within a friendly team environment.
Financial industry experience a plus, but not a requirement

Job Title: Jr. C++ Software Engineer - ArcGIS Runtime SDK
Job Description:
Overview


Do you have a passion for APIs and SDKs and want to work with the latest developer technologies? Are you the kind of person who loves making a difference? Want to be part of a team that leads the way in developing innovative technology? Then Esri may be the place for you! We’re on a mission to hire talented software engineers who can help us find innovative ways to make Esri software reach new audiences. This is a superb opportunity to design and create next-generation Esri technology.

As an engineer on the ArcGIS Runtime SDK team, your work will range from designing and testing new features to communicating how to use our developer APIs and improving usability of our SDKs. You'll receive mentorship and have training opportunities to help ensure a good start to a successful long-term career. As you gain experience, you can grow your career in a number of directions including becoming a top-notch software developer solving the most technical of problems, a developer evangelist working with users to drive adoption and understand use cases, or a product owner who manages projects.

Requirements
Familiar with cross-platform software development
Enthusiasm to learn GIS and mapping technology
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong time management, prioritization, teamwork, and interpersonal skills
Ability to understand new technology concepts quickly and apply them accurately through an evolving, dynamic environment
Bachelor’s or master’s in computer science, GIS, mathematics, or a related field
The Company


Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. Esri’s geographic information system (GIS) technology inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the changing world around them.

Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.

Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email humanresources@esri.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail address.

Your Opportunity


The Developer Experience team at New Relic is focused entirely on supporting the developer who is extending and pushing the limits of what’s possible with New Relic’s platform and tools. We encourage planning and developing in the open and creating an experience that our customers can learn and apply to their own business and technical needs.

This team is an outstanding place to grow as an engineer. We have smart, encouraging teammates, a wide product and technical landscape to explore, and an abundance of leadership and technical challenges and opportunities where you can shine. If you’re a mid-level frontend engineer who is ready to work on a set of fun, high quality projects in open source, this might be the role for you!

Opportunity to work from a remote office may be available depending on applicant location.

What You’ll Do
Contribute to the team’s customer impact by building thoughtful, high quality code that is easy to read and maintain.
Periodically lead projects from start to finish.
Propose innovative product potential that will deliver maximum value to our customers.
Increase the impact of one or more team members through mentoring, pairing, and support.
Join our on call rotation and provide support to internal customers.
Identify and eliminate technical debt so that we can deliver faster with less complexity.
Write and share proposals to improve team processes and approaches.
Always have our customer in mind. Luckily this is pretty easy for us, since our customers are developers like us.
Your Qualifications


Must-have:
At least 4 years of professional frontend development experience
Experience reviewing PRs and applying standard methodologies to reviews
Collaborative working style and excellent communication skills
High level of emotional intelligence and self awareness
Nice-to-have:

Experience with React, Gatsby, and AWS Amplify
Experience working in open source
Experience with GraphQL
Experience with Elixir, Kotlin, and / or Node
Experience setting up healthy reliability practices
Experience writing for internal or external blogs
Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

Our Office


Our office is in the center of downtown Portland, situated in a thriving tech community in the Pacific Northwest. We enjoy easy commute access and a plethora of good eats and great coffee. We provide competitive compensation including equity and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc.)—all while maintaining the energy, agility and fun of a start-up.

About Us


New Relic (NYSE: NEWR) is the industry’s largest and most comprehensive cloud-based instrumentation platform built to create more perfect software. The world’s best software and DevOps teams rely on New Relic to move faster, make better decisions and create best-in-class digital experiences. If you run software, you need to run New Relic. We’re proudly trusted by more than 50% of the Fortune 100.

Founded in 2008, we’re a global company focused on building a culture where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging, where every ‘Relic’ can bring their whole self to work and feel supported and empowered to thrive. We’re consistently recognized as a distinguished employer and are committed to building world-class products and an award winning culture. For more information, visit newrelic.com.

Our Hiring Process


In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.

We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records based on individual circumstances and in accordance with applicable law including, but not limited to, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. https://sfgov.org/olse/sites/default/files/Document/FCO%20Poster%20Set%20All%20Languages%2010%2001%2018.pdf

New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Interested in the details of our privacy policy? Read more here: https://newrelic.com/termsandconditions/applicant-privacy-policy

#LI-PY1

Software Engineer - Kafka Platform Team
Your Opportunity


The Kafka Platform team is seeking a growth mindset software engineer to join a team that is responsible for maintaining, growing, scaling, and automating New Relic’s Kafka and Zookeeper ecosystem! If you are comfortable working with large distributed data systems and have a particular interest in effective patterns and practices for automating their care and maintenance activities, let chat!

We are also migrating to the cloud, starting with AWS/MSK and eventually supporting a multi-cloud environment. Any experience in cloud operations or distributed application development would be very helpful!

New Relic's engineering culture emphasizes team autonomy, which means that each team chooses how they do their work and has a say in which projects they work on. It also means that our teams are responsible for their own operational tooling and on-call rotation. We strive to reduce dependencies between teams so that we can work at an efficient velocity without blocking others.

Opportunity to work from a remote office will be available for these locations: Chicago, Philadelphia, Detroit, Baltimore, and Washington D.C.

What You’ll Do
Engage with architects, team leads, and team members to introduce new patterns for using our shared Kafka infrastructure in ways that increase the efficiency and reliability of our shared platform.
Maintain and improve the internal Kafka client libraries used by multiple teams at New Relic to add better monitoring and resiliency features.
Contribute to our automation framework that provision repeatable infrastructure and clusters, helping us scale to handle rapid growth and expand into the public cloud.
Build new applications and services to support our client teams.
Your Qualifications


Must-have:
Proven experience in enterprise-level Java development and preferably experience working with distributed applications with high efficiency & availability.
Familiarity with stream processing with Kafka and cloud-based development.
Experience with a cloud computing platform such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Microsoft Azure.
Comfortable working in a Unix environment.
Nice-to-have:
Experience writing software in Go, C, or Scala.
Experience writing a Kubernetes operator.
Familiarity with AWS MSK.
Familiarity with Python.
Familiarity with Kafka from the client perspective.

#LI-PY1

Primary Function


We are seeking an experienced software validation engineer to join our large fortune 500 client. In this role, you will validate the Distributed Asynchronous Object Storage (DAOS) being developed. The I/O software stack must be optimized to prevent a storage bottleneck as we engineer for substantial throughput increases today and plan for the increased demand in coming years. We are looking for a test engineer who can learn this new I/O stack and demonstrate its abilities at scale and under load, finding critical bugs before it is put into production.

Duties & Responsibilities
Develops, modifies, and executes software test plans and automated test cases.
Understands new features from existing documentation and reading C source code.
Writes unit, integration, and stress tests to verify these features work.
Drives development of system-level validation software.
Debugs software products through the use of systematic tests to develop, apply, and maintain quality standards for company products.
Analyzes test results to ensure correct functionality.
Maintains documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of software.
Independently determines root causes of failures and recommends corrective action, working closely with development to drive resolution of bugs.
Seeks opportunities to drive improved validation methodologies within the team.
Skills & Qualifications
Must have programming experience in both C and Python as you will be writing unit tests to exercise C APIs as a primary function of this role.
Must understand distributed computing as you will be debugging parallel systems in this role.
Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related plus 6 years of industry work experience, or a Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related plus 4 years of industry work experience, or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related field plus 2 years of industry work experience.
To Apply


Use the link at the bottom of this page to apply. Please use Chrome, Firefox, or Safari (users may experience issues with Internet Explorer).

Our mission is to help organizations, big and small, embrace the cloud-native culture. We believe that cloud-native organizations can better help their customers and improve their businesses.

We are drastically improving the way engineers and developers work with Ambassador (https://www.getambassador.io), the leading Kubernetes-native API Gateway built on Envoy Proxy. Developers can change the world. Empowered developers can change the world faster.

Datawire empowers developers to own the services they deliver. With service ownership, developers write, deploy, release, and run code all in a self-service manner, enabling them to receive immediate feedback and creating an accelerating loop of experimentation and improvement. Our customers code, test, and ship services at blistering fast rates compared to their competitors.

Built for Kubernetes managed environments, our flagship product, the Ambassador Edge Stack, goes beyond traditional API Gateways and Ingress Controllers with the advanced edge features needed to support developer self-service. The ease of installation, breadth of services, and support for full-cycle development have resulted in thousands of companies adopting Ambassador Edge Stack including Microsoft, PTC, Nvidia, and Ticketmaster. Our leadership team come from the likes of Rapid7, New Relic, SmartBear and Red Hat, to name a few. Headquartered in Boston, MA, Datawire has development locations around the world including Portland, Canada (Montreal), UK, Europe and India.

Software Development Technologist:
Uses specialist embedded software and/or Windows Desktop application software knowledge to lead the development of innovative software prototypes that solve complex problems and/or demonstrate significant improvement over current solutions regarding stability, performance and scalability (e.g. new added-value features, better quality and/or reliability, higher performance, lower cost, etc.).

Edwards is a leading developer and manufacturer of sophisticated vacuum products, exhaust management systems and related value-added services. The Oregon National Primate Research Center (ONPRC) is located 12 miles west of the OHSU main campus, and sits on 162 acres of land featuring forested areas, research and administration buildings, indoor and outdoor animal housing, a pond, and 2-mile perimeter walking path. Our mission is to improve human health and the quality of life through the support of nonhuman primate research programs that advance our knowledge of the causes, preventions, treatments, and cures of debilitating diseases.

This position will support modern web-development for two closely related projects. The Macaque Genotype and Phenotype Project (mgap.ohsu.edu) is an NIH-funded project to analyze and share large-scale genomic data. The position will also support a related internal website (prime-seq.ohsu.edu) dedicated to data analysis and processing. The developer will be responsible for the maintenance of existing features and development of new features for each website. The majority of new features will be end-user facing, and require experience with client-side UI, including modern JS frameworks. Examples of upcoming projects include the creation of interactive web pages to view genomic data and integration with the ReactJS-based JBrowse2 genome browser. This position does not involve direct work with non-human primates. Experience with professional development practices, such as version control, development/release cycles, build systems, and automated testing is required. Coding will occur in multiple languages.
While this position is primarily software development, knowledge of biology is highly preferred. A basic understanding of DNA sequence analysis and genomic data sets will be essential to effectively develop new features. Depending on the applicant background, a portion of time may include data analysis in addition to software development

Doctorate degree in relevant field OR Master’s degree in relevant field and 5 years of relevant work experience, OR Bachelor’s degree in Biology, Computer Science, Biostatistics and 9 years of relevant work experience
An undergraduate degree with an exceptional record of software development would be considered
At least one year experience in professional-level web development with demonstrable work product
Experience working with modern JS frameworks, such as ReactJS or Angular
Ability to communicate effectively, in both written and oral formats
Ability to work both independently and in a small group setting, and one-on-one with collaborators in a positive and productive manner
Working knowledge of Javascript, Java, and Linux
Demonstrated independence and competence to perform complex software design and development
Ability to prioritize work demands, and coordinate with other staff
Organizational skills and careful attention to details to satisfactorily perform job duties
Quality control and review of data skills
High level of self-motivation and integrity

Here's the opportunity for you. We're a nimble and lean team who hustles to unlock huge results for our clients. You'll be developing conversion optimization tests and strategies for clients like Adobe, Xerox, and mid-sized online clothing retailers. And you'll make a meaningful and measurable contribution to driving online revenue for The Good's clients.

Summary

The Front-End and A/B Test Developer role is responsible for working with the CRO Strategy team to deliver The Good's Conversion Growth Program™ for a subset of clients.

This entails using front-end development skills to implement the A/B and multivariate testing roadmap in platforms such as VWO and Optimizely. Additionally, you'll be using qualitative and quantitative data with the goal of highlighting useful information, drawing actionable conclusions, testing hypotheses, and supporting informed decision making.

This role should have a strong interest in:
Front-end development including CSS, JavaScript and HTML
Knowledge of UX design best practices, and understanding of mobile-first and responsive design
Learning how to find solutions to improve goal conversion through multivariate test implementation, event tracking, and data analysis
Building A/B or multivariate tests for solving problems such as page or cart abandonment
Finding the most effective online customer experience
This position reports to Director of CRO Strategy.

Applications without a cover letter will not receive a response. Must provide requested salary in cover letter.

Qualifications

A qualified candidate for this role will exhibit the following:
Must have at least one year of front-end development expertise, with credentials to back it up (such as code school graduation or relevant industry experience)
Experience using client-side JavaScript libraries such as JQuery, Angular, and React
Experience with ecommerce focused platforms like Shopify, Magento, BigCommerce, as well as Wordpress and others.
Experience with Google Analytics including the custom goal and event tracking
Experience or desire learning using wirefame/mockup tools and UX design software like Sketch, UXPin, Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
Holds The Good's belief that the customer's needs come first online (vs the brand's needs) and likes what they see in our Insights
Experience with Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Behavior-Driven Development (BDD) concepts
Soft skills – is very detail oriented, a quick thinker in pressure situations, and not afraid to pick up the phone over sending an email
Highly creative – we're constantly looking for the points of highest leverage since we're small and scrappy
Detail oriented – loves to-do lists and checking off the items
Entrepreneurial – wants to work on a small team, and willing to contribute when/where needed
Duties

This role will be asked to do the following functions on a regular basis:
Front End Development – Responsible for the overall design, style, layout, features, and code quality of tests developed, ensuring they meet the client's brand guidelines and standards
Collaboration – Collaborate with other developers to create and maintain a consistent and effective use of UI components and style guidelines. Work with strategy team to understand detailed requirements of the tests you're working on and design user experiences that meet their needs.
Adaptability – Be able to identify the coding standards used on any given project and adapt your code to fit into the existing codebase.
Consumer and UX Research – Setup and monitor A/B tests, consumer surveys, and analyzing website and marketing campaign performance.
Flexibility – Be ready to dive in to contribute where needed most, critique, and improve our client results.
Tools, Trends and Innovation – Awareness of latest conversion optimization trends and technologies; research and adopt effective techniques that improve the client's bottom line. Actively seek out events and growth opportunities and then share your learnings with the greater team.
Scorecard Metrics

The role's success will be determined through the following scorecard metrics:
Successful launch of 90% or greater of experiments developed and live on the client's site
Cares deeply about online end consumer satisfaction, happiness and loyalty
Can handle working on 6-8 accounts simultaneously
Obtains and maintains industry recognized certifications
Core Values

At The Good we thrive by holding true to three core values that we expect every team member to uphold in themselves, and one another:
Be a force for change. We find opportunity in every challenge and take action to make things better.
Make improvements, not excuses. We hold each other accountable to grow through practice, not perfection.
Inspire by example. We challenge each other to risk temporary setbacks in pursuit of lasting progress.
About The Good

A little about our “Why”.

At The Good we know what ecommerce leaders really want is to have a website that produces a lot more revenue from their existing traffic. In order to do that, they need to convert more of their website visitors into buyers. The problem is, they don't know how to get their conversion rate to the next level which makes them feel frustrated and stuck.

We believe every ecommerce leader deserves a clear path that helps them realize their website's true conversion potential. We understand how challenging it can be to take an existing website to its next level, which is why for almost 10 years we have been helping ecommerce sites increase their conversion rates without the need to increase traffic.

In fact, we've written the book on it: Stop Marketing, Start Selling.

We are proud to be a certified B-Corporation.

B Corps are a new type of company that uses the power of business to solve social and environmental problems. While The Good has sought to hold ourselves to higher standards as a matter of principle, the certification has helped to add another layer of outside accountability and transparency. B-Corp has evaluated how our practices impact our employees, their community, the environment, and our customers. To learn more about our certification, check out The Good's B Corp profile.

Learn more about The Good.

Your Opportunity


As a Software Engineer working on the Telemetry Data Platform, you will have the opportunity to help build high-throughput, high-availability services that operate at a scale rare within the industry. Performance, reliability, and maintainability are bedrocks of our software, and collaboration, boldness, and empathy across disciplines and teams are fundamental to how we build that software.

What You’ll Do


Software Engineers are responsible for the entire software development lifecycle, including deployment, operation, and maintenance. This requires an understanding of the patterns and tradeoffs inherent in building scalable systems and a belief that observability, operability, and reliability should be included from the beginning.

Your Qualifications


Must-have:
2+ years of building software in a compiled backend language such as Java, Go, and Rust.
2+ yrs of professional experience deploying and shipping software in a software production environment.
Knowledge of fundamentals required to build and operate highly-available software at scale including data structures, architectural patterns, and distributed systems.
A desire to work as part of a team that values curiosity, efficiency, and quality and strives to strike a balance between thoroughness and delivery.
A willingness to be on-call for the software you build and a genuine desire to learn from mistakes.

As the foundation of New Relic's product offerings, the Telemetry Data Platform supports our customers with core functionality for data ingestion, transformation, storage, and retrieval. We own our software from top to bottom and are directly responsible for its quality and reliability. Each member of the team shares a pager rotation, so we prioritize work that keeps the lights on and the pager quiet in addition to the work that powers all of our new products and streams of data.

If you're eager to both learn from and teach fellow engineers and non-engineers alike, build best-in-class products, and work on systems that process millions of messages per second and handle petabytes of data, please be in touch!

What You’ll Do


Software Engineers are responsible for the entire software development lifecycle, including deployment, operation, and maintenance. You will be developing automation for and operating massively scalable systems. This requires an understanding of the patterns and tradeoffs inherent in building scalable systems and a belief that observability, operability, and reliability should be included from the beginning.

Your Qualifications

3+ years of professional experience deploying and shipping software in a software production environment.
Fluency in a statically-typed, compiled backend language; Go preferred but Java, C, or C++ are acceptable.
1+ years of experience with Kubernetes.
Experience using the command line to manage, investigate, and fix things when they’re broken.

Experience on distributed teams. Our team is currently based out of the Portland office, but we are part of a group that is distributed across North America and Europe. An ability to work well asynchronously and communicate your thoughts in writing will be a big asset.

This role will interact with multiple internal and external partner groups for DBA activities.

This position's responsibilities will include: installation, upgrades and optimization, backup/recovery, access control administration, database vendor contract administration, disaster recovery support, development and test environment support, documentation, and infrastructure and methodologies improvements. Monitors database performance and seeks opportunities for tuning and improvement. Consults with and advises users on various database issues and works with internal and external teams. Projects, plans and implements long-range requirements for database administration and design. Co-ordinates the system and application DBA functions for both development and production environments. Prepares activity and progress reports in relation to database management and provides technical leadership to other team members.

Job Responsibilities

? Implement & configure SQL Server software ( including DBMS, SQL Reporting Services, SQL Server analysis services, SQL Server integration services, )

? ? Develops and documents standards, procedures, work instructions for database support that help in increased productivity for operations.
? Optimizes database accessibility by developing load balancing architectures and processes to eliminate down time for backup processes.
? Implements and supports database security regulations, policies, and guidelines. Monitors security bulletins to obtain information of potential threats; installs necessary security patches to ensure ongoing database security.
? Assists project managers in the development of project plans including detailed project estimates and tasks required for database activities. Utilizes standard corporate tools to record change and problem activities for tracking purposes.
? Translate business goals into strategy and actionable objectives
? Conduct project scoping, chartering, execution strategy, process improvement activities and change management
? As need be manage and develop team members/partners
? Serve as the primary interface for the business to interact with all IS services
? Identify and remove barriers by working with internal and external stakeholders
? Prioritize workload in accordance with goals
? Write Scripts
? Participate in Root Cause Analysis reviews when applicable.
? Rotational 24x7 On-Call Support
? Accountable for all audit and security compliance issues ( company & government regulations).

Job Title: Senior Software Engineer - Kafka Platform Team (Remote)
Job Description:
Opportunity to work from a remote office may be available depending on applicant location.

Your Opportunity


The Kafka Platform team is seeking an experienced DevOps-focused senior software engineer to join a team that is responsible for maintaining, growing, scaling, and automating New Relics Kafka and Zookeeper infrastructure. The ideal candidate will be comfortable and experienced in working with large distributed data systems and have a particular interest in effective patterns and practices for automating their care and maintenance activities. This diverse team is currently comprised of a mix of both Software Engineers and Site Reliability Engineers, so if youre interested in contributing and growing at that intersection, this would be a great role for you! We are also migrating to the cloud, starting with AWS/MSK and eventually supporting a multi-cloud environment. Any experience in cloud operations or development with systems at scale would be a bonus.

New Relic's engineering culture emphasizes team autonomy, which means that each team chooses how they do their work and has a say in which projects they work on. It also means that our teams are responsible for their own operational tooling and on-call rotation. We strive to reduce dependencies between teams so that we can work at an efficient velocity without blocking others.

What Youll Do
Use your experience with ops automation and informed opinions about what works and what doesnt for a given situation to define the path forward for major projects.
Engage with architects, team leads, and team members to introduce new patterns for using our shared Kafka infrastructure in ways that increase the efficiency and reliability of our shared platform.
Use your DevOps savvy to operate a large scale Kafka cluster that is the foundation of New Relic's data pipeline.
Maintain and improve the internal Kafka client libraries used by multiple teams at New Relic to add better monitoring and resiliency features.
Contribute to our automation framework that provision repeatable infrastructure and clusters, helping us scale to handle rapid growth and expand into the public cloud.
Your Qualifications


Must-have:
5+years of hands-on experience and proficiency in one or more of these languages: Java, Python, Go, or C.
Experience with streaming in general (e.g. spark streaming) and Kafka in particular.
Development and support of Kafka integrations, including topics, producers, consumers, and streaming applications (Bonus).
Experience with a cloud computing platform such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Microsoft Azure.
Experience with and passion for the operational automation of distributed systems, such as Apache Kafka or Apache ZooKeeper.
Experience writing distributed applications with high availability.
Proven communication skills, both written and oral.
Experience working in Linux systems.
Nice-to-have:
Experience writing software in Java or Go.
Experience writing a Kubernetes operator.
Experience with Configuration and fine-tuning of Kafka for optimal production performance.
Familiarity with AWS MSK.
Familiarity with the Linux shell and a scripting language such as Python or Ruby.

Job Description

As a software engineering intern, you will be part of a small R&D team, that path-finds next-gen technologies to improve Intel's memory and storage products and associated software stacks.

This position is with Storage Technologies Group (STG), within Non-Volatile Solutions Group (NSG), which is responsible for Architecting NSG's NAND and Optane based products and for researching future directions for these products and their role in the overall computing system. In this role you'd join a R&D team of top-notch engineers setting the course for the future of persistent memory, storage and computing. You will be working closely with a cross Intel team of experienced engineers in designing and evaluating next generation memory technologies optimized for AI/ML. Your pathfinding responsibilities will include design, development, debug, experimentation-with, and analysis of core improvements to the underlying technologies.

The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:
Self-motivated individual willing to take and follow directions and deliver to schedule
Communication and interpersonal skills
Quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skills, problem/conflict resolution skills
Prioritization and time management skills
Working with diverse team environment and in cross-site organizations
This is very interesting work, very rich for innovation. We are looking for someone who is nimble and can grasp new ideas quickly. This is a very fluid area, so tolerance of ambiguity is going to be key for success in this assignment.

This U.S. position is open to U.S. Workers Only. A U.S. Worker is someone who is either a U.S. Citizen, U.S. National, U.S. Lawful Permanent Resident, or a person granted Refugee or Asylum status by the U.S. Government. Intel will not sponsor a foreign national for this position.

Qualifications

You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Minimum Qualifications:
The candidate must be pursuing a BS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field.
Minimum 1+ year of experience and/or coursework in the following:
Software engineering, Python and C/C++ programming skills.
Knowledge of computer architecture and operating systems fundamentals.
Knowledge and interest in the non-volatile memory and storage domain, and application of NVM technologies (esp. Intel Persistent Memory, and/or SSDs).
Preferred Qualifications:
Knowledge of Linux driver development
Knowledge of Machine Learning
Understanding of the low-level microprocessor architecture.
Knowledge of architect, design, develop, debug, experiment-with and analyze technologies at the HW/SW boundary (e.g., to be able to prototype and evaluate key technologies in software and/or OS driver domains).
Knowledge of Verilog, RTL design using an FPGA
Inside this Business Group

Non-Volatile Solutions Memory Group: The Non-Volatile Memory Solutions Group is a worldwide organization that delivers NAND flash memory products for use in Solid State Drives (SSDs), portable memory storage devices, digital camera memory cards, and other devices. The group is responsible for NVM technology design and development, complete Solid State Drive (SSD) system hardware and firmware development, as well as wafer and SSD manufacturing.

The Job:

moovel North America is an urban mobility company helping make cities smarter. Every day we help improve the lives of local communities through accessible and delightful user experiences within our city-branded mobility applications. By partnering with cities, public transit agencies, and end users worldwide, we’re helping transform cities by providing convenient and sustainable solutions powered by our Mobility platform.

We’re looking for a Software Engineer to help shape the future of mobility together. We have a beautiful office space that fosters collaboration and creativity in one of the coolest buildings in downtown Portland. We have many perks of tech with an open and flexible work environment, fun extracurricular activities and a unique culture that puts people first. What we’re looking for is exceptional people who share a passion for developing creative solutions that advance our mission and vision. As moovel’s next Software Engineer you’ll be responsible for delivering world-class products to transit agencies and users throughout the world. The ideal candidate believes development is a team activity and enjoys it being that way. They thrive in a fast-paced environment and are willing to fill any role to help their team be successful.

What You’ll Be Doing:
Working collaboratively in an agile cross-functional team
Contributing to the design and development of new products and services
Supporting existing products and services that people are using everyday

Contributing to front end web development when needed

Estimating level of effort and story points to support planning
Contributing to architecture and technical solution design
Utilizing your technical expertise to help solve problems and propose solutions
Other duties as required by the company
Required Qualifications and Skills:
3+ years of hands-on development experience
Experience working in an agile development environment
Proficiency in Javascript, Node.js
Practical experience with web development using multiple frameworks
Experience with automated testing frameworks and concepts
Experience in micro-service or service oriented architectures
Strong understanding of RESTful principles
Experience and expertise with source control (git)
Familiarity the AWS stack
Preferred Qualifications and Skills:
BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject
Familiarity with JIRA, Confluence or similar tools
Hands-on experience with relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL)
Familiarity with GraphQL
Understanding of virtualization and containers (Docker)
Mobile development (Android or iOS) is a plus
Required Attributes:
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively and effectively in a team environment
Ability to work independently and propose solutions via pull requests and proofs of concept
Willingness to dive deep into the existing code base and the curiosity to learn through experimentation
Preferred Attributes:
Ability to be productive with a multiple languages, frameworks and paradigms
Willingness and capacity to learn new frameworks and languages quickly
Positive attitude
Who We Are:

moovel North America
Headquartered in Portland, OR, moovel NA offers competitive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, and disability benefits at no cost to employees. We also offer a generous holiday schedule with four weeks of PTO annually. Our compensation program includes a 3% retirement contribution, and competitive base salaries.In addition to the more traditional benefits, we offer a cell phone allowance, a welcoming environment for dogs of all sizes and many other perks. You will also have the opportunity to work with a diverse team in our Portland office as well as with our parent company, Strategic Mapping, Inc., based in Toronto, Canada.

Our office is centrally located in the heart of Old Town, bike friendly, and within walking distance to a multitude of restaurants, bars, and shops. The Portland Streetcar and TriMet offer easy-to-use transit services connecting the downtown Portland district to the Pearl District and greater Downtown Portland.

moovel provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Strategic Mapping Inc.
Strategic Mapping is a privately owned company and a complete end–to–end provider of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS). Strategic Mapping offers hardware design, software application and system integration services to many of North America’s leading transit agencies.

Strategic Mapping was founded in 2006, with locations in both the United States and Canada. With 14 years of expertise in the transit space, they are dedicated to providing innovative, scalable, user friendly and cost effective technologies for agencies of all sizes. Their advanced Smart Bus applications are designed to streamline day-to-day operations by providing transit agencies with tools to better manage their fleet while simultaneously enhancing trip planning, accessibility and the passenger experience.

Job Title: Mid-Level Full Stack Software Engineer - 4+ years of experience
Job Description:
CEOs everywhere are digital leaders now, whether they are ready or not. What was once run and grow the business, is now run and respond.

In a world where we must now all be ready to work-from-home and lead-from-home, WorkBoard's Enterprise Results Platform enables high-growth, and high-scale companies to align on outcomes, measure results, coordinate actions, and better manager meetings. Its OKR and WFH coaching services and certification program drive fast success for our customers. Comcast, Microsoft, Cisco, Workday, Zuora, Seismic, Cision, Malwarebytes, McKesson, Samsung, and many others rely on WorkBoard to drive their business forward. a16z, GGV capital, M12 (formerly Microsoft Ventures), and Workday Ventures are key investors.

COMING IN

We're looking for a candidate with critical thinking, with a strong background in building successful products or platforms and the ability to design from solid design principles; you thrive in dealing with rapid delivery with quality; you have a quintessential attitude to deal with the problems' solving, attention to detail, and you're comfortable learning new technologies and systems.

This role is important, not only for WorkBoard but for the future of the digital transformation.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Build and implement a wide range of systems, processes, and technologies to own and solve problems from end-to-end.
Work with engineers across the company to build new features at large-scale.
Uphold our engineering standards, security, design and bring consistency with the best practices and processes you will encounter
Deeply understand the plumbing of modern API solutions, front end architectures, and the importance of dev unit tests.
Brainstorm solutions by collaborating with internal and external stakeholders across the organization such as experts product, design, infrastructure, and operations, with your domain knowledge
Participate in extreme programming and peer reviews, learn and share your work with the team.
Bringing the best work of your life, enjoy collaborating with WoBo family members, and going home happy, on time.
YOU WILL
Have 4+ years of experience shipping enterprise-ready products and APIs
Enjoy being a generalist working on both the frontend, backend, and anything it takes to solve problems and delight users
Thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders and subject matter experts
Have empathy with the many different domains of customers who use WorkBoard's APIs
Take pride in working on projects to successful completion involving a wide variety of technologies and systems
Bridge and connect different services and processes together even if you have not worked with them before
Customer-centric thought process to come up with high-impact ways of solving their problems
Have experience in systems and services and write high-quality code. Here our code stack is PHP (7.2.x), and Javascript (NodeJs). However, languages can be learned: we advance the engineering side of knowledge than a language/framework.
WE LIVE BY THE 4 Hs

Humble experts

Hungry for the opportunity

Intellectually honest

Operating as one happy team

A FEW OF OUR BENEFITS
Unlimited PTO & sick days
Paid holidays
Health insurance
401K with employer matching
Quarterly All-Hands Meetings where we come together to learn AND play
And much more!
THE WORKBOARD STORY

WorkBoard provides a powerful, modern results platform to help companies achieve their growth plans. Unlike most enterprise software, our solution is important to every employee, so we strive to set the high bar for capabilities that delight and enable everyone to be more successful at work. WorkBoard is strategic to companies and personally relevant to the people that work in them.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates learning, diversity and inclusion. If you're hungry to grow your skills while growing a company, your sense of urgency matches the size of our market opportunity, and you value and enable teammates' contributions, then come join us!

Job Description

The Senior Software Developer performs end-to-end design, programming, and testing work related to the implementation, enhancement, and support of the ConMet platform and applications. As a full stack developer, the individual will be responsible for developing and designing front end/backend architecture and ensuring the responsiveness of the platform and associated applications. The successful candidate is expected to be able to manage and execute software and system development lifecycle activities, build operational procedures, troubleshoot and communicate to all technical, business stakeholders and working alongside product, graphic designers, IT and have knowledge in all stages of software development.

This role is a newly created opportunity and will be based at ConMet's corporate headquarters in Vancouver, Washington (Portland metro area).

Day to day, you’ll:
Gather and assess development requirements and/or specifications from business stakeholders

Design and develop scalable Microservices/APIs
Develop web and mobile applications
Ensure platform optimizations
Maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of applications
Work alongside graphic designers for web design features
Develop front end web architecture
Design user interactions on web pages
Maintain existing software by gathering requirements, conducting tests, analyzing errors, refining programs, and providing technical assistance and support
Resolve problems related to system updates, installations, interfaces, and other issues associated with existing software
Trace and corrects bugs and deficiencies in software
Provide support, technical explanations, and documentation
Identify opportunities to re-engineer/integrate existing platform and processes
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering or equivalent degree
Minimum 5+ years proven experience as a full stack developer or similar role
Proficiency with fundamental front end languages (i.e. HTML, CSS and JavaScript)
Minimum 3+ yrs. of experience, or equivalent skills, with FE frameworks (AngularJS, React.js)
Familiarity with CSS preprocessors, bundlers, and associated languages/syntaxes/libraries
Minimum 3+ years of experience, or equivalent skills, with server side frameworks/languages (specifically Java, Python, and NodeJS)
Experience with design and construction of REST API’s
Minimum 3+ year’s experience, or equivalent skills, with RDBMS and NoSQL technologies (i.e. AWS RDS, PostgreSQL and MongoDB)
Preferred Qualifications:
Proficient in horizontally scalable software design for high volume high uptime environments.
Experience implementing testing platforms and unit tests
Experience with implementing tooling for various stages of DevSecOps
Code Quality, Testing, Resiliency Patterns, Observability (Monitoring, Tracing, Logging, Alerting)
Source control with code hosts such as Github, BitBucket
Knowledge of Amazon Web Services.
Containerization with Docker, and related orchestration tools
Virtual Machine experience
Any Experience on BI tools is a plus.
Understanding of CloudNative applications and fundamentals around building them.
Security-focused mindset, in addition to experience with security-oriented tooling, threat modeling, etc.
Participated in the Scrum based Agile development methodology
Mobile IoT application experience a plus
Working knowledge of the 12 factor application methodology.
Minimum 3+ year’s experience with AWS Lambda with compiled and non-compiled languages.
Who Is ConMet?

ConMet is a leading global manufacturer of wheel hub assemblies, interior and exterior plastics, and aluminum casting components for the commercial vehicle industry. With innovative products, such as PreSet Plus® SmartHub, and PreSet Plus® Electric Hub, ConMet is the undisputed leader in the development of lightweight, high performance products for the heavy-duty truck and trailer industry.

ConMet is headquartered in Vancouver, Washington, U.S.A., with 14 additional locations throughout North America and China. While ConMet is an ISO 9001, ISO 9002 and TS 16949 Certified Manufacturer, they are also recognized as a quality supplier, having earned more than thirty awards and recognitions for excellence.

For more information about our company, visit our web site at www.conmet.com. ConMet is a subsidiary of Chicago-based Amsted Industries (www.amsted.com), one of the world’s largest transportation component manufacturers, and one of America's largest 100% employee-owned (ESOP) companies.

Comprehensive employee benefits package, including medical/dental/vision coverage, life and disability protection, and our innovative new vacation plan.
Participation (100% company paid) in the ConMet/Amsted Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP)
Company 401k program (with 5% company match)
College tuition reimbursement (up to $5,000/year) and internal employee development programs
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $50 per month)

Job Title: Technical Program Manager, Systems Architecture, Supply Planning
Job Description:
Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Portland, OR, USA

Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Technology, Engineering, Science, Economics, related field, or equivalent practical experience.
7 years of experience with technical architecture, product management, tools/process development, and/or data integrity
5 years of experience managing other developers
Preferred qualifications:
Experience working with senior-level stakeholders.
Experience working with developers, data architects, and product development teams to ensure delivery of product.
Ability to write solid and appealing technical documentation and user manuals.
Work with data management concepts and activities including Data Sourcing, Data Quality Management, Metadata, and Enterprise Data Management Policy, Process, and Procedures.
About the job


Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

As a Technical Program Manager for Systems Architecture, you'll be responsible for driving the development of automation for supply planning of data center capacity. This automation will impact capacity investment globally and ensure consistent decision making and the ability to run complex scenario analysis. This automation will transform our operations.

You will work with supply planning analysts, software developers, site negotiation teams, capacity planners, and many other stakeholders to understand business drivers and convert those into technical specifications and new software and tools. You’ll need to set the roadmap, drive engagement, align visions, and advocate cross-functionally. You will work broadly across the data center site selection strategy team and with stakeholders from multiple levels of the organization.

Together, we work on tough problems with multiple stakeholders and dynamic challenges.
Responsibilities
Set the vision and strategy for supply planning systems architecture and development.
Convert business objectives into technical design documents.
Work cross-functionally with software developers, business owners, executives, and other stakeholders.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. Job Title: Technical Program Manager, Data Center Supply Planning Analytics
Job Description:
Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Portland, OR, USA

Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Technology, Engineering, Science, Economics, Statistics, a related field or equivalent practical experience.
5 years of experience in building and running portfolio optimization models, incorporating statistical simulation and risk.
5 years of experience in a capital-intensive industry.
Preferred qualifications:
Ability to navigate ambiguity.
Ability to execute in a highly cross-functional environment.
Excellent communication skills.
About the job


Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

As a Technical Program Manager for Data Center Supply Planning Analytics, you’ll be responsible for evaluating the entire life cycle of a data center, identifying constraints, organizing and evaluating data, and modeling supply scenarios. You’ll work with teams across diverse domains and geographies to convert data center construction activities into a robust model that drives decisions about what we build, where we build, and when we build. To be effective, you'll differentiate between signal and noise, know when the data you are given is of sufficient quality and if it is needed to drive sound decisions.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
Responsibilities
Develop supply planning scenarios, including managing data intake and validation.
Run the models and evaluate scenarios in order to make recommendations about data center supply decisions, especially as it pertains to uncertainty and tradeoffs in time versus cost.
Coordinate cross-functional stakeholder groups to make decisions about data, constraints, and supply optimization.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

The Company

EnergyRM is on a mission to unlock investment in deep energy efficiency in commercial buildings. We provide a SaaS platform that aligns economic interests and turns deep energy efficiency into a sound financial investment. We’re growing and need your help enabling our customers to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions.

It’s an exciting time at EnergyRM. We’re a venture-backed startup that’s getting a lot of attention. EnergyRM has innovative tech and a great team. We’re poised to make a significant impact on the climate by reducing energy consumption. We need your help to make it happen!

The Role

This is an early role with a lot of room for growth and impact. As a Backend Software Engineer, you'll report directly to the Principal Engineer and work closely with other product leadership to build core features across the whole stack. Along the way you'll help improve our software engineering processes and shape our culture and organization.

Software engineers at EnergyRM are empowered to work with discretion and autonomy. Growing in the role means learning to self-manage a project from start to finish. This includes communicating and collaborating effectively by participating in product planning, seeking clarity from product and technical stakeholders, and proactively keeping the task tracking system up to date for visibility and accountability.

You’ll work at EnergyRM’s HQ in Portland, OR.

About You
You believe that the best software engineering is about more than programming: it’s also about relationships with the people who are making and using the product.
You believe in the power of communication, empathy, and mutual support. You want to be part of a team that believes the same.
You want your work to be meaningful with a measurable positive impact on the world.
You believe that reducing greenhouse gas emissions and conserving the world’s energy resources is good business.
Qualifications
You have 2+ years of experience as a software engineer in a professional setting
You enjoy backend development: APIs, databases, and core domain logic
You aim to grow as a full stack developer
You write tests because they give you confidence
You’re comfortable with JavaScript
You have worked in a language with static typing
You’re comfortable working in a MacOS or Linux environment
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues
If you are unsure if your experience is a match, we encourage you to apply! We'd love to hear from you.

Bonus Qualifications
Experience with GraphQL
Experience with TypeScript
College-level experience with physics or statistics
Experience in data science
The Tech Stack
Frontend: TypeScript, React, GraphQL
Backend: TypeScript, Node, GraphQL
Infrastructure: Docker, AWS Fargate
The backend is organized around a core collection of interactors (aka service objects), each responsible for validating and executing one whole business action.

Code changes are reviewed in pull requests and deployed multiple times a day with a CI/CD pipeline. Feature flags restrict access to incomplete functionality until it's ready.

Why EnergyRM is a Great Place to Work

We are committed to nurturing a safe and inclusive environment for all voices. We live to learn from others. We communicate with empathy and curiosity, not ego or aggression. We are here to make the world better (certified B Corp!), not play buzzword bingo in a disruption incubator.
We enjoy a collaborative environment that celebrates innovation in trying to solve complex problems
Work collectively towards our mission that contributes impactful results for generations
We foster an environment that emphasizes a learning and growth mindset outweighs the skills and abilities you may or may not have today.
Our benefits package includes a generous medical & dental insurance package, generous PTO, 401k matching, and a flexible work schedule.
Other

EnergyRM provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics.

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

The Informatics Development Operations Engineer works as part of an cross-functional agile team who create innovative software solutions to support cutting-edge biomedical research. This position ensures the smooth operation and optimization of research computing infrastructure. As a member of the Oregon Clinical and Translational Research Institute’s Informatics team, you will ­design and build innovative, data-driven web applications and automation tools to provide critical research support in fulfillment of OCTRI’s mission to improve human health by enhancing the efficiency and quality with which research ideas are translated into impact.
The Oregon Clinical Translational Research Institute (OCTRI) at OHSU is a catalyst for scientific collaboration, translation of biomedical advances into the community, innovation and research growth in Oregon and beyond. OCTRI’s mission is to enhance the efficiency and quality of rigorously translating research ideas into impact. To accomplish our mission, our 80-90 employees spread across 13 teams provide a broad expanse of clinical and translational services that include training, funding, research support, and community engagement. OCTRI is part of the National Center for Translational Sciences (NCATS)-funded CTSA consortium that encompasses 50+ hubs around the country. Visit our website to learn more: octri.org.

This position requires collaboration with a diverse set of OCTRI research informatics staff to (i) identify and implement opportunities to achieve a robust, reliable and efficient software development platform; (ii) provide easy-to-use and reliable mechanisms for product release and deployment; (iii) translate abstract research processes into concrete software applications using informatics techniques; (iv) develop computer systems critical to clinical and translational research protocols; and (v) communicate system/application designs to technical and non-technical peers, both verbally and in writing.
Candidates must have at least 3 years of experience with routine system administration tasks such as commercial and open source software installation, configuration, and optimization, with product like Apache httpd, MySQL and Tomcat. Candidates must have at least 1 year of experience with a configuration management tool such as Puppet or Chef. Ideal candidates will have experience designing secure and performant infrastructure utilizing virtualization and containerization with tools like Docker and Kubernetes. Candidates must have experience with data-driven web-based applications, working with databases and source control repositories. Candidate will have advanced skills with at least one interpreted or compiled language (e.g., Java, Python, Go, Groovy, Bash, etc.).
Experience in an open-source, and/or research-oriented informatics environment is preferred. Candidates must be able to demonstrate a history of self-motivated and detail-oriented work and/or research. Candidates must be comfortable working both independently and collaboratively with a small software engineering team in an agile environment (e.g. Scrum) and must have strong oral and written communication skills. Candidates must have the ability to learn unfamiliar technologies in support of legacy software as well as new initiatives.

Master’s degree with major courses in relevant field and 3 years of relevant experience; or Bachelor’s degree with major courses in field and 5 years of relevant experience
At least 3 years experience in system administration, specifically with Apache httpd and Tomcat servers in a Linux/Unix or similar environment. At least 1 year experience using a system configuration tool such as Puppet or Chef. Demonstrated experience in an open-source environment
2 years supporting containerized workloads with Kubernetes or other container orchestration systems
At least 1 year experience developing data-driven web applications or pipelines with Java or a similar object oriented language
Experience in an open-source environment
Demonstrated experience in the gathering, assimilation, organization, categorization and analysis of data
UNIX/Linux systems administration
Developing tools to automate routine system management
MySQL database administration and optimization. Working knowledge of SQL
Experience with an object oriented programming language and development frameworks and experience in developing systems that interface with a variety of standard and proprietary data sources (e.g. SQL relational databases, Web Services, XML)

About Providence in Oregon.
As the largest healthcare system and largest private employer in Oregon, Providence offers exceptional work environments and unparalleled career opportunities.

The Providence Experience begins each time our patients or their families have an encounter with a Providence team member and continues throughout their visit or stay. Whether you provide direct or indirect patient care, we want our patients to feel that they are in a welcoming place where they can be comfortable and free from anxiety. Our employees create the Providence Experience through simple, caring behaviors such as acknowledging and welcoming each visitor, introducing ourselves and Providence, addressing people by name, providing the duration of estimated wait times and updating frequently if timelines change, explaining situations in a way that puts patients at ease, carefully listening to their concerns, and always thanking people for trusting Providence for their healthcare needs. At Providence, our quality vision is simple,

"Providence will provide the best care and service to every person, every time."

Providence is consistently ranked among the top 100 companies to work for in Oregon. It is also home to two of our award-winning Magnet medical centers. Providence hospitals and clinics are located in numerous areas, ranging from the Columbia Gorge to the wine country to sunny southern Oregon to charming coastal communities to the urban setting of Portland. If you want a vibrant lifestyle while working with a team highly committed to the art of healing, choose from our many options in Oregon.
