Job Summary
As a Staff Software Engineer working on full-stack security solutions development you will lead the development activities for the Acceptto Authentication Appliance product. You will work in a cross-functional Agile development environment to develop SaaS security products that meet and exceed Acceptto’s strategic Enterprise customers’ requirements and expectations. You will be working with Product Managers and Sales Engineers to develop a deep understanding of customer’s requirements and objectives and work closely with your fellow Security Architects in applying your creativity and broad set of skills to create smart solutions to security problems and challenges.

You will work closely with Architecture, Product, and Engineering leadership teams to help align on the architectural and product visions and help define the product roadmap. You will also partner closely with engineering teams to deliver against a backlog established and groomed in partnership with product owners. You will mentor and guide other software engineers, ensuring rigorous engineering processes and best practices.

The successful candidate is a validated leader with excellent communication and relationship-building skills in addition to current, hands-on coding skills.
We don't need you to just code, you must also be able to solve unique and complex problems that have a broad impact on the Acceptto’s business. You should be able to persuade a cross-functional group of peers to embrace proposed solutions and allocate resources accordingly. Most importantly you must have the depth of knowledge, experience, and passion to deliver solutions that amaze our customers.

At Acceptto we look for individuals who are constantly striving for excellence in both their personal and professional lives. Our rapid growth demands high performance, and we’re proud to say that we have a talented and motivated team along for the ride. If you’re looking for a new challenge, or eager to learn new technologies in a fast-growing and innovative company, join us. Let’s innovate together.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities (including, but not limited to):

eGuardian® is Acceptto’s backend security and analytics engine. It is the backbone of a completely new paradigm shift in enterprise authentication, allowing the convergence of consumer behavior patterns with ever-changing regulations and cybercrime techniques to allow IT, managers, to stay ahead of the threat curve while providing their customer base the best possible user experience.

As a Staff Software Engineer, You:

• Lead the Appliance development team and provide mentorship to team members as needed.

• Consult with departments or customers on project status and requirements.

• Work in Python, and Ruby on Rails and with REST APIs to architect, design and develop new features, capabilities, and usages in the Acceptto Appliance products.

• Develop new front-end features using modern JavaScript frameworks such as VueJS.

• Provision and deploy services on Linux servers using Docker and corresponding toolset.

• Modify existing software to fix errors, adapt it to new platforms, improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces.

• Develop automated unit and integration tests in order to improve the software quality.

• Continuously evolve the eGuardian® and the Appliance software architectures.

• Work with customers or departments on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.

About Acceptto:
Acceptto is a well-funded start-up based in Portland, Oregon: Our core team is in Portland, Oregon, with other development teams in Vancouver BC, Canada, and Portugal.
• At Acceptto, everyone owns the product and the product is our passion.

• No one works 9-5. We're a start-up.

• We think big, move fast and have strong opinions.

• We frame things up and expect you to fill in the blanks.

• We are open to great ideas and are willing to experiment.

• Everyone executes and delivers.

• If you work with Acceptto you will share in our success.


Our Stack

• Languages: Python / Ruby / JS / C++

• Frameworks: RoR / VueJS / Django / Flask

• Databases: PostgreSQL / MySQL / Redis


About You:
• You have solid technical and team leadership skills

• You take pride in your work by implementing cutting-edge technologies and writing state-of-the-art code.

• You own your projects from software design to implementation and deployment.

• You emphasize simplicity and pragmatism, which is reflected in your elegant code that other developers emulate.

• You love to learn and develop new skills continuously.

• You thrive on working with new technologies.

• You challenge the status quo when needed.

• You have the drive to get results and not let anything get in your way.

• You have the habit of leaving the code cleaner than when you found it

• You are a team player that provides constructive input and fosters positive relationships with team members

• You have a thirst for knowledge and an interest in learning other programming languages as needed

• You are passionate about automated testing, automated deployment pipelines, and continuous integration and delivery.


Skills & Experience We’re Looking For:
• Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems or equivalent work experience

• Deep understanding of security technologies including Multi-Factor Authentication, identity and access management, PKI, and virtualization technologies.

• Significant breadth and depth in architecture, development, and implementation of software products including full-stack web applications deployed in a SaaS environment.

• 8+ years of experience in Software Development, using modern technologies and frameworks in Python, Ruby/Ruby on Rails, HTML/CSS/JS and VueJS, C++, and highly scalable cloud-based development

• 5+ years in a lead engineering role responsible for architecture and design decisions and hands-on engineering experience focused on delivering enterprise-scale systems

• 3+ years of deployment experience with public or private cloud services (AWS or similar cloud providers).

• Experience implementing CI/CD pipelines

• Strong skills in team leadership and building positive relationships across Product, Architecture, and Engineering, and the ability to influence decisions and changes across teams

• Ability to define solution options, provide estimates on effort and risk, and evaluate technical feasibility

• Ability to contribute anywhere in the stack and wear multiple hats.

• Experience working with Agile frameworks, processes, and teams

• Experience in a microservice architecture, and RESTful APIs using languages such as Python, and Ruby

• Deep understanding of Linux, Docker, Git, SQL, Postgres, and No-SQL databases.


Preferred:

• Programming experience with any of the following languages is a plus:

o NodeJS

o Go

o Java

• Experience with serverless design

• Experience with adopting OWASP top 10

• Hands-on experience configuring and troubleshooting SAML/SSO authentication.


Physical Requirements:

• Ability to travel as required, estimated at 10 percent of the time.

Location, Perks &

• Portland, Oregon

• Outstanding total compensation package (base salary and benefits)

• Considerable opportunity for career development, coaching from a seasoned executive team and professional growth

Collage.com is fortunate to remain open for business during the COVID-19 crisis and to see demand for our product increase. We have been a fully remote workforce for seven years and have been recognized as a leader in remote working. Our employees have continued working with minimal disruption and our hiring efforts are proceeding as planned. By continuing to help our customers bring their special memories to life, we hope to bring smiles to their faces during these stressful times.

Collage.com's mission is to make custom products easy for everyone. We strive to do this by providing superior software and excellent customer service. We sell an expanding variety of photo and home products, including photo blankets, photo books, canvases, pillows, and more. Our company has been featured on the TODAY Show, The View, and Good Morning America many times. We are a 100% employee-owned company that has rapidly grown to 60 employees and $50M annual revenue since 2013.

As a 100% remote company, we are set up to provide the best possible environment for engineering. The less time developers spend dealing with cumbersome processes, inefficient systems, and commuting, the more time they have to solve problems and make an impact. Collage.com's co-founders/co-CEOs both come from a technical background and believe in staying at the forefront of best practices so that we can focus on work that matters. We pass almost all of The Joel Test (we only fix high-priority bugs before writing new code, but hey, we're a start-up), use continuous deployment (code goes straight to production after each merge), and are in the process of adopting mobx-state-tree with React. Strong engineering is a key part of our business strategy -- it lets us build best-in-class design tools faster than our larger competitors.

We are seeking an ambitious and nice senior full-stack engineer who shares our passion for building a great software company. This is a unique opportunity to have a major impact on our engineering team's growth (we are about ten strong right now) by helping us continually raise the bar. You will be expected to collaborate with other engineers to solve complex technical problems and push us to deliver higher quality code at an ever-increasing rate. We firmly believe in the power of solid architecture, code design, and simplicity over brute force, which is why we do our best to hire 10x senior engineers. If you are seeking an environment where you get to do meaningful work with other great engineers, then we want to hear from you.

Learn more about working and developing software at Collage.com.

Responsibilities
Write and maintain front-end JavaScript code as part of a mobile-first web application, including UI components and state management logic, as well as back-end PHP and front-end network communication code (back end is approximately 10% of work).
Make decisions about code design, architecture, and refactoring to balance technical debt against delivering functionality.
Plan and lead testing for complex projects.
Review code and mentor other engineers.
Provide time estimates and participate in agile development.
Review specifications and work with PMs to implement lean methodology.
Required Qualifications
Experience implementing and testing advanced JavaScript code on a team as part of a production web or mobile application
Practical experience with MV* architecture (such as Backbone, Vue, React + Redux/Mobx, etc.), unidirectional data flow, and minimal class/object interfaces
Spatial/geometric reasoning ability -- for rendering, animation, and image manipulation
Ability to quickly understand and work with unfamiliar complex code
Pro-active and clear communication is essential for this remote work position
Benefits and Perks
Working from home makes it easier to focus on results and develop professionally while spending less time commuting. (See our opinion piece on perks and work-life balance at mlive.com.)
401(k) plan, home internet reimbursement, and $3,000 / year in free Collage.com products plus employee discount for friends and family.
Collage.com pays 100% of the premium for full health, vision and dental insurance coverage for you and your family in a high-quality Blue Cross Blue Shield PPO plan.
Flexible work schedule and unlimited vacation policy (work hard and take time when you need it).
We'll pay for any computer and home office equipment (within reason) that will help you work better.
The Interview Process


The goal of our interview process is to identify people who will be a good fit for our company and are talented, ambitious engineers. Because you will be working remotely, all of our interviews are done over the phone in close succession to move through the process quickly. We look for candidates with good written and verbal communication skills.

We ask all candidates to demonstrate strong coding ability at the beginning of our interview process. The questions are in Javascript and focus on applying general programming concepts (like concurrency and good code structure) in realistic scenarios that should be familiar to experienced engineers. We do not test for knowledge of esoteric language features, APIs, or algorithms. We prefer engineers who are smart and able to learn over those who are familiar with our exact tech stack.

During the interview process, you will talk to other engineers, your future manager, a product manager, and both founders/CEOs of the company. We believe in transparency, and will give you the opportunity to speak with anyone else you'd like to meet before accepting an offer. You are making an important decision, and we want to make sure you are fully committed to joining our team.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

SENIOR SOFTWARE QUALITY ENGINEER

AllMed Healthcare Management’s mission is to improve the quality and integrity of healthcare by providing independent medical review services that help payers and providers deliver better health outcomes. We provide pre-authorization and appeals decision-making services through PeerPoint®, AllMed’s state-of-the-art Medical Review Portal. We partner with over 300 leading US health insurance and hospital organizations and have maintained consistent 20% annual growth, through our commitment to the highest quality, client satisfaction, and technology innovation. We have recently undergone a lean transformation, driving continuous improvement in our performance. As a result, AllMed’s client list includes many of the nation’s top names in healthcare.

We are seeking an experienced Senior Software Quality Engineer to join our Information Technology team. This is a full-time opportunity working at our office in downtown Portland, Oregon.

POSITION DESCRIPTION

The Senior Software Quality Engineer role is responsible for performing the software quality assurance function at AllMed. The software quality assurance process involves evaluating and testing new or modified software programs to verify that the software functions according to stakeholder and business requirements and conforms to established quality guidelines.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Writes, revises and verifies quality standards and test procedures to attain quality of software economically and efficiently
Reviews new or modified software, including specifications, to determine if software will perform according to requirements and conform to quality guidelines
Recommends software improvements and corrections to software engineers
Reviews computer operating logs to identify software processing errors
Run software programs to test for validity of results, accuracy, reliability, and conformance to requirements and quality guidelines
Sets up tests at request of users and programmers to troubleshoot program operating errors
Conducts compatibility testing to ensure software is compatible with various operating environments and other software/hardware components as stipulated in the requirements
Writes documents that describe software evaluation, testing, and correction
Writes scripts to automate testing where practical
Writes and manages defect reports
Works with requirements tracking and defect reporting systems
Reports quality assurance status to project managers and stakeholders as required
Develops or recommends tools to test, track and verify defects in software programs
REQUIRED SKILLS

The position is frequently varied and involves solving problems of high complexity. A strong technical proficiency in testing methodologies and quality assurance is required. The incumbent exercises judgment within generally defined engineering practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining results. The incumbent works directly with software engineers, other software QA engineers, project managers, clients, operations managers, executives and end users. The incumbent may supervise and/or direct the efforts of other testers. Job skills required include:
Proficiency in current software QA technologies
Experience testing on the Microsoft Windows platform
Software scripting ability for test automation
Ability to perform basic SQL queries for the purposes of data validation
Experience testing web applications, desktop applications, software API’s and databases
Ability to isolate and describe complex software failures
Ability to write and execute test plans and strategies
Ability to clearly communicate QA status
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, science field or equivalent experience
Five years of relevant experience in engineering, QA, or testing in high technology
Experience and knowledge of multiple development processes and in leading the software QA effort for projects throughout a software development lifecycle are required
BENEFITS

AllMed offers generous compensation and our competitive benefits program includes comprehensive medical and dental care, matching 401K, paid time off, flexible spending accounts, disability coverage, and other benefits that help provide financial protection.

AllMed provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, AllMed complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

About OpenSesame

OpenSesame helps develop the world's most productive and admired workforces. With the most comprehensive catalog of elearning courses from the world's top publishers, we are here to help you every step of the way, from finding courses, mapping them to your core competencies, syncing them with your LMS to increasing utilization and improving your L&D programs. Not only will you have the flexibility of multiple purchasing options from OpenSesame, but you'll also find it simple to use and administer your e-learning courses. To learn more, visit www.opensesame.com/about.

About the Team

Our Delivery team builds the systems that allow our customers to effortlessly deliver courses to their learners. This includes building API integrations with our partners, updating CourseCloud (our simplified course delivery platform for small businesses), and facilitating the ability to download course packages when an integration may not exist.

About the Job

As a Senior Front End Software Engineer, you will be one of the technical leaders on the OpenSesame Engineering team. You will be responsible for building the front end application that our customers interact with to deliver their courses to their learners. In addition, you will be a critical part of OpenSesame's front end group that works across all engineering teams to guide the future of the frontend at the company.

Job Objectives
Lead and provide input to the front end development efforts of the team to ensure we account that our UI is responsive, accessible and compatible with all of our supported browsers.
Develop easy to use and accessible interfaces that allow our customers to deliver their courses to their learners.
Work with other front end engineers to develop repeatable patterns we can use across the front end applications used at OpenSesame
Contribute to and support our component library and styling engine to increase design consistency, development speed and customization within our platform.
Be the go-to person for UI work on the Delivery team.
Work with Product and Design to migrate legacy UI into newer technologies
Develop and implement a strategy for breaking apart a monolithic Angular application in order to facilitate easier development across teams
Use your expertise to create efforts to find and fix performance bottlenecks within our Angular applications.
Work collaboratively with your team members via pair programming to help share knowledge and develop better solutions. Two minds are better than one.
Desired Qualities
Never be satisfied, always finding room for improvement in process and technology.
Possess excellent technical and personal communication skills including writing documentation and diagraming when appropriate.
A deep belief in lifelong learning.
Requirements / Qualifications
5+ years of experience working with front end technologies such as Javascript/Typescript, HTML, CSS, and MVC frameworks.
Deep knowledge of Angular Javascript framework
Experience in developing applications that conform to the WCAG Accessibility Guidelines
Experience working with design teams, and knowledge of workflow/handoff practices.
Experience with design/prototyping tools such as Figma, InVision, etc.
Great understanding of modern Javascript build systems and performance tools, i.e. Webpack
Knowledge of cross-browser compatibility
Experience working with and creating a data layer using tools such as Redux, NGRX, etc.
Wide range of experience with modern front end testing practices and frameworks (i.e. Protractor, Jest, Jasmine, React Testing Library, Cypress, etc.)
Preferred
Multiple years of experience with Angular (v5 or newer)
History of leading improvements amongst previous teams and companies
SPA application and/or micro front end experience.
Experience working with NGRX

Job Title: Senior Software Engineer (Portland, Dallas, Chicago, Los Angeles, New York, Remote)
Job Description:
At Apex Clearing, we're all about building the next-generation trade clearing platform that enables the hottest stock trading apps the capabilities they need to introduce a new generation to investing. We need passionate, determined, courageous, and principled software engineers like you to help us achieve this mission. If what you need next in your career is an opportunity to be empowered to make your own decisions, learn from your mistakes and execute what works, Apex Clearing is likely the place for you.

The Opportunity:


The Apex Clearing product development team is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to provide technical leadership and inspiration for a development team at the heart of Apex Clearing's high-volume, high-availability trade clearing suite. We partner with some of the industry's hottest next-generation stock trading products. You'll be at the center of rapidly scaling services that will test your limits.

Apex Clearing product development teams are charged with building the services our clients love and are at the heart of our future product innovations. Apex has begun its transformation from on-premise infrastructure to the Cloud (GCP & AWS), and our team is responsible for transforming our products into the next generation clearing platform that will lead our industry for years to come. We are in need of smart, senior developers to build out our cloud-native (GCP/AWS), event-driven (Apache Kafka), Microservices framework.

What you will do:
Lead designs of major software components, systems, and features.
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software.
Manage project priorities, deadlines and deliverables with your technical expertise.
Mentor & train other team members on design techniques and coding standards.
Build resilient, self-scaling, self-healing services that allow you to sleep through the night.
Support the production systems that you build. This includes build, deployment (CI/CD), and monitoring (Grafana, Prometheus, PagerDuty).
Writing high-quality, well-tested code. Maintaining high code-quality standards across your team via code reviews, mentoring & coaching.
What you can expect:


A highly collaborative environment where everyone is focused on outcomes that build momentum for Apex to reach its goals.
A culture that values a test-centric approach to software development where 100% unit test coverage is the expectation.
End-to-end ownership of what you deploy. From documentation to service-level objectives, your team is ultimately responsible for the health of your products.
Contribute to and benefit from a culture of continuous learning. Access to mentors, generous policies regarding attending industry conferences and book reimbursement, regular lunch and learns.
Quarterly 2-day hackathons.
An environment committed to using the right tool to get the job done.
Work that matters.
The skills you'll need to succeed:


6-15+ years of experience as a software developer or similar job roles.
BA, BS, MS, PhD in Computer Science, Engineering or related technology field.
Proven experience in at least one modern language (Java, C#, C++, Go, etc.).
Experience hiring, mentoring, and coaching other engineers.
Ability to learn new technologies (languages, tools, frameworks) quickly.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform / Amazon Web Services is a strong plus.
Experience with Kubernetes and/or Docker is a plus.
Experience with Apache Kafka, AWS Kinesis, or Google Pub/Sub is a plus.
Financial services background is a plus.

Background

We have been in business for over 15 years and employ more than 175 people from our headquarters in Portland, and across our satellite offices in San Diego, Austin, Jacksonville Beach, Ashland, and Vietnam. For six years running we continue to be honored as one of Inc. 5000's and Portland Business Journal's Fastest Growing Private Companies, and there is little sign of slowing down!

Why this Role? Why Now?


Part of being a true Technology Partner to our clients mean that when they grow, we are right there with them! As a service-based company, we pride ourselves on the agility and speed with which we can bring new products and applications to-market for our customers. As we continue to build elite development teams around this philosophy, we are seeking a Senior Technical Lead to own the execution of high-value, high-impact software solutions against key client initiatives. With the support of experienced Project and Product Management, you will be owning the technical excellence of custom software solutions delivered across a variety of business areas and domains. You will work directly with stakeholders at the client-level, as well as fast-moving, business-driven internal resources in collaboration towards a common goal.

Track record of working with onshore/offshore resources fluently

We are insanely proud of the high employee retention and work culture we have built here at AltSource, but we never allow ourselves to feel we have arrived. We believe hiring uniquely talented individuals with diverse backgrounds and life experiences is the only way to continue to create a compelling product and service to our customers. While we offer amazing perks like a beautifully appointed headquarters in SE Portland, replete with ping pong, locker/bike rooms, catered breakfasts/lunches and enough Kombucha to fill the Mt. Tabor Reservoir, we don't believe that those things are the foundation of true, substantive culture.

At our heart, we are a group of builders and doers who are obsessed with seeking a better way to drive client value. Collage.com is fortunate to remain open for business during the COVID-19 crisis and to see demand for our product increase. We have been a fully remote workforce for seven years and have been recognized as a leader in remote working. Our employees have continued working with minimal disruption and our hiring efforts are proceeding as planned. By continuing to help our customers bring their special memories to life, we hope to bring smiles to their faces during these stressful times.

Collage.com’s mission is to make custom products easy for everyone. We strive to do this by providing superior software and excellent customer service. We sell an expanding variety of photo and home products, including photo blankets, photo books, canvases, pillows, and more. Our company has been featured on the TODAY Show, The View, and Good Morning America many times. We are a 100% employee-owned company that has rapidly grown to 60 employees and $50M annual revenue since 2013.

As a 100% remote company, we are set up to provide the best possible environment for engineering. The less time developers spend dealing with cumbersome processes, inefficient systems, and commuting, the more time they have to solve problems and make an impact. Collage.com’s co-founders/co-CEOs both come from a technical background and believe in staying at the forefront of best practices so that we can focus on work that matters. We pass almost all of The Joel Test (we only fix high-priority bugs before writing new code, but hey, we’re a start-up), use continuous deployment (code goes straight to production after each merge), and are in the process of adopting mobx-state-tree with React. Strong engineering is a key part of our business strategy -- it lets us build best-in-class design tools faster than our larger competitors.

We are seeking an ambitious and nice senior full-stack engineer who shares our passion for building a great software company. This is a unique opportunity to have a major impact on our engineering team’s growth (we are about ten strong right now) by helping us continually raise the bar. You will be expected to collaborate with other engineers to solve complex technical problems and push us to deliver higher quality code at an ever-increasing rate. We firmly believe in the power of solid architecture, code design, and simplicity over brute force, which is why we do our best to hire 10x senior engineers. If you are seeking an environment where you get to do meaningful work with other great engineers, then we want to hear from you.

Learn more about working and developing software at Collage.com.

Responsibilities
Write and maintain front-end JavaScript code as part of a mobile-first web application, including UI components and state management logic, as well as back-end PHP and front-end network communication code (back end is approximately 10% of work).
Make decisions about code design, architecture, and refactoring to balance technical debt against delivering functionality.
Plan and lead testing for complex projects.
Review code and mentor other engineers.
Provide time estimates and participate in agile development.
Review specifications and work with PMs to implement lean methodology.
Required Qualifications
Experience implementing and testing advanced JavaScript code on a team as part of a production web or mobile application
Practical experience with MV* architecture (such as Backbone, Vue, React + Redux/Mobx, etc.), unidirectional data flow, and minimal class/object interfaces
Spatial/geometric reasoning ability -- for rendering, animation, and image manipulation
Ability to quickly understand and work with unfamiliar complex code
Pro-active and clear communication is essential for this remote work position
Benefits and Perks
Working from home makes it easier to focus on results and develop professionally while spending less time commuting. (See our opinion piece on perks and work-life balance at mlive.com.)
401(k) plan, home internet reimbursement, and $3,000 / year in free Collage.com products plus employee discount for friends and family.
Collage.com pays 100% of the premium for full health, vision and dental insurance coverage for you and your family in a high-quality Blue Cross Blue Shield PPO plan.
Flexible work schedule and unlimited vacation policy (work hard and take time when you need it).
We’ll pay for any computer and home office equipment (within reason) that will help you work better.
The Interview Process


The goal of our interview process is to identify people who will be a good fit for our company and are talented, ambitious engineers. Because you will be working remotely, all of our interviews are done over the phone in close succession to move through the process quickly. We look for candidates with good written and verbal communication skills.

We ask all candidates to demonstrate strong coding ability at the beginning of our interview process. The questions are in Javascript and focus on applying general programming concepts (like concurrency and good code structure) in realistic scenarios that should be familiar to experienced engineers. We do not test for knowledge of esoteric language features, APIs, or algorithms. We prefer engineers who are smart and able to learn over those who are familiar with our exact tech stack.

During the interview process, you will talk to other engineers, your future manager, a product manager, and both founders/CEOs of the company. We believe in transparency, and will give you the opportunity to speak with anyone else you’d like to meet before accepting an offer. You are making an important decision, and we want to make sure you are fully committed to joining our team.

Job Title: Front End UI Developer II (Portland/San Jose/Austin)
Job Description:
Power the Possibilities
The CDK Global technology team is looking for collaborative innovators who are passionate about making their mark on emerging enterprise software products. We’re building and developing cloud technology for the automotive retail industry
that will change the landscape for automotive dealers, original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and the customers they serve.

Be Part of Something Bigger
Each year, more than three percent of the U.S. gross domestic product (GDP) is attributed to the auto industry, which flows through our customer, the auto dealer. It’s time you joined an evolving marketplace where research and development
investment is measured in the tens of billions. It’s time you were a part of something bigger.

We’re expanding our workforce – engineers, architects, developers and more – onboarding early adopters who can optimize, pivot and keep pace with ever-evolving development roadmaps and applications.

Join Our Team
Growth potential, flexibility and material impact on the success and quality of a next-gen, enterprise software product make CDK an excellent choice for those who thrive in challenging, fast-paced engineering environments.
The possibilities for impact are endless. We have exceptional opportunities to evolve our industry by driving change through new technology.

If you’re ready for high-impact, you’re ready for CDK.

Position Summary:

The Drive Flex team is seeking a Front-End engineer to help take our premier SaaS-based Dealer Management Solution (DMS) to the next level. It's built using React on the Front-End complimented by a micro-services architecture on the back-end built on Java running in containers on AWS. We're an agile shop so comfort/experience with that development process is a must.

POSITION CAN BE BASED IN PORTLAND/SAN JOSE/AUSTIN

Overall Responsibilities:
Participate in the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) developing new features and functionalities for large-scale enterprise software solutions, encompassing service layers, integration, user interfaces, and data.
Perform software design, development, testing, documentation, code review, and analysis. This will be biased towards the back-end but full-stack experience is also encouraged/welcomed!
Implement technical solutions that satisfy business requirements for function, performance, security, and maintainability.
Document software deliverables through use cases, design documents, and technical specifications. This includes helping with story creation, acceptance criteria, QA and overall end-to-end testing.
Perform gap analysis and document findings.
Create and design programming code.
Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience, in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field with at least 3 years of programming experience or a Master’s degree.
Experience Requirements:
Front-end development, preferably in React JS. We'll consider folks that have a background in Angular but understand we're a React shop.
JavaScript, JSON, HTML, CSS
CSS-in-JS styling frameworks, including Styled Components, BEM, and CSS Modules
Component design, Redux, and testing patterns
REST APIs
React Tesing Library (RTL) and/or some other testing solutions such as Enzyme
SaaS application engineering
Jira and its effective usage for the management of software projects.
Nice to have -- familiarity with the Attlassian suite -- Confluence, Bitbucket, Bamboo
Who do we look for? We look for people with the right cultural fit. That means being passionate and enthusiastic and having what it takes to drive our business forward. We also look for people who are keen to develop new knowledge and skills, because our growth is ultimately dependent on yours. Finally, we look for leaders; people that will own their solutions, take initiative, drive change and champion excellence.

What can we offer you? To help us attract and retain the best, we pay people according to performance, not tenure. Excel in your role here and the rewards will be excellent too. We will also help you to grow your career, not only through focused investment in learning and development but also by enabling you to explore the opportunities our global market has to offer. Start your Journey with CDK Global.

CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work. You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to not only take care of you but your family as well. All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including 401K matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few.

At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. Job Title: Principal Software Engineer - Aviation Network Technology
Job Description:
What you’ll be doing...

We’re looking for a Principal Software Engineer to join our Aviation Network Technology team. You’ll be working in an exciting startup environment within the foundation of a large company, Verizon. You will have the freedom and autonomy to do your best work, with the support and camaraderie you need to enjoy your job. In this role you will be contributing to the future of connected aviation within Verizon’s New Business Incubation team.

As a Principal Software Engineer, you will play a vital role in aligning Skyward’s and Verizon’s efforts both in the development of technology as well as the standards that enable the acceleration of cellular connected aviation. In this role, you will participate in design and development of the system architecture, collaborate with internal and external partners, and develop and contribute to Verizon’s aviation interests in applicable aviation and telecommunication standards. You’ll work with our strategy and Aviation Development Center teams to develop inputs to standards and translate standards into input to product designs. The role will be part of a cross-discipline team focused on enabling 4G LTE and 5G connectivity in the drone and urban air mobility industries.

Responsibilities:
Lead, plan, design, develop, guide, improve the system design and architecture across cloud services, devices, networks, and partners to enable cellular aviation products.
Work with diverse teams to deliver product increments in an agile fashion.
Become a connected aviation subject matter expert, understanding embedded systems and the architecture, opportunities, and challenges of cellular network technologies.
Make clear decisions that promote well-defined, timely Verizon/Skyward capabilities and communicate our positions to concerned stakeholders.
Prioritize and define what standards Skyward & Verizon should develop, which we should monitor, and which we should actively counter, working with all stakeholders.
Work to incorporate standards into products and services across teams and partners.
Effectively communicate your knowledge of standards, product requirements, and needs to stakeholders in everyday verbal and written communication.
What we’re looking for...

You'll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Aviation, or similar technical discipline, or 4 additional years of experience.
6 or more years of relevant work experience.
Experience in leading system software design and architecture incorporating cloud microservices that interact with at least one of the following: network or cellular connectivity, device applications, or embedded software.
Experience working with and contributing to standards.
Even better if you have:
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Aviation, or similar technical discipline, or 6 additional years of experience.
10 or more years of relevant work experience.
Strong ability to define alternatives and make appropriate recommendations and strategies for the software ecosystem.
Experience in the connected vehicle, aviation, or telecommunications industries.
Experience in machine learning, video processing and analysis, live data streaming, or geospatial technologies.
Experience with security and reliability over variable connections.
Ability to navigate ambiguity and drive balance between experimentation and productization requirements in a dynamic environment. Previous startup environment experience is a plus.
Experience with FAA-regulated aviation products, such as avionics systems.
Clear written and oral communication skills.
Experience and a passion for working with and improving Agile processes.
Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work with and motivate team members, peers, and leadership.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Outstanding attention to detail and organizational skills.
When you join Verizon...

You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.

Equal Employment Opportunity

We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

This is an outstanding 1-2 year contract opportunity with our client, a well-respected market leader, located near Washington Square Mall in Beaverton.This position entails developing web applications using ASP.NET MVC, AngularJS, Web Api, and SQL Server for high-volume, mission critical use. The role will primarily focus on hands-on coding of the project using the technologies listed below. Proven ability to organize workload and priorities and complete tasks on time & to work effectively in a team environment. Acts as a resource for other software engineers; and a liaison between department manager and other analysts, as well as the business team.

Responsibilities:

Use Agile Scrum SDLC methodologies in the full life cycle software development process including requirements analysis, software design, prototyping, programming, debugging and testing of system software production applications. Participate in technical design and implementation. Proactively raises issues if specification will lead to quality, system performance, or architectural issues in product. Collaborate with fellow developers in areas of expertise as well as members of business unit. Demonstrate self-directed and proactive approach to solving problems. Develop, debug and deliver enterprise applications. Demonstrate self-directed and proactive approach to solving problems. Proactively mentor fellow developers in areas of expertise.

5+ years of experience developing software in C# / .NET

3+ years of experience developing web applications using ASP.NET, with experience using MVC a plus.
Experience writing multi-tier components for high volume systems
Experience with SQL Server, with Entity Framework experience a plus.

Experience with AngularJS or similar client side framework a plus.
Experience with ASP.NET Web Api a plus.

Experience with load balancing technologies a plus
Strong oral and written communications skills
Outstanding troubleshooting and technical support skills

Distinguishing features for a Senior Software Engineer, in addition to those listed above, may include:
2+ additional years of experience developing software in C#/.NET/ASP.NET
Advanced degree or training in related technical field preferred

Distinguishing features for a Lead Software Engineer, in addition to those listed above, may include:
1+ additional years of experience developing software in C#/.NET/ASP.NET
Prior experience leading teams in a professional, open and forthcoming manor

THIS POSITION IS OPEN TO W-2 CANDIDATES ONLY. NO THIRD PARTIES PLEASE.

Company Description

Cash App is the fastest growing financial brand in the world. Initially built to take the pain out of peer-to-peer payments, Cash App has gone from a simple product with a single purpose to a dynamic app with over 24 million monthly active users. We are bringing a better way to send, spend, invest, and save to anyone who has ever sought an alternative to the traditional banking system.

Loved by customers and pop culture, we’ve consistently held the top spot for finance in the App Store for many years, seeing more engagement with millions of followers across social media in a day than most brands see in a year. We are building an ecosystem to redefine the world’s relationship with money by making it universally accessible.

We want to hire the best talent regardless of location. Our employment model is distributed, offering the opportunity to collaborate with teams across the world in San Francisco, New York, St. Louis, Portland, Toronto, Kitchener-Waterloo, Sydney, and Melbourne.

Interested in learning more?

Job Description

Cash App is a quick, easy, and free way to send money. The Cash engineering team is responsible for the code that makes this work. We care about infrastructure that makes it easy to write software that is secure, efficient, and tested. We build incrementally with small changes and we deploy to production every day.

As a member of the Cash engineering team, you’ll collaborate with us to:
Design data models to support application features
Build APIs used by apps and microservices
Scale systems to our growing customer base
Operate and manage Cash services
Unit test everything
Share ownership of the product
Contribute to the broader tech and open source communities
Qualifications

You have:
Strong desire to perform and grow as an engineer
Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
Demonstrated technical initiative on previous projects
Technologies we use and teach:
Java 8 including JUnit, Hibernate, Guice, and Jersey
HTTP, JSON, gRPC, and Protocol Buffers
MySQL
Additional Information

Cash App treats all employees and job applicants equally. Every decision is based on merit, qualifications, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with each office’s corresponding local guidelines.

At Schoolhouse we’re designers, makers, and creative thinkers, and since 2003 we have handcrafted custom lighting and lifestyle products that transcend time and trend. Just as important as the products we make are the people we work with. They are at the heart of everything we do. We’re always looking for hard working, innovative people to join the Schoolhouse team

Summary:

The Lighting Designer & Developer brings along a proven track record of compelling lighting design work and has a clear understanding of the relationship and balance across design, production, and scalability. This individual will spend their time planning, designing and prototyping lighting designs in collaboration with Product Management, Product Development, New Product Introduction and Leadership/Ownership to deliver designs that meet the holistic opportunities and needs of our design driven business. This individual will quickly develop a keen understanding of the Schoolhouse business, brand, values, team, innovation agenda and design aesthetic which they can translate into fresh, heirloom quality and successful lighting developments. This person will bring a track record of success in lighting design conception, as well as managing the complex product development processes. They will also be responsible for ensuring product meets or exceeds pre-determined gross margin targets and other merchandising and business goals. The Lighting Designer’s success will be gauged by their ability to contribute to the successful launch of multiple fresh and new top-sellers as well as helping to maintain and extend our position as design thought leaders in the market.

Key Functions:

Communicates with manager and product team to understand opportunities in our current product line in terms of style, function, customer needs and retail price.
Communicates with Ownership/Leadership to make sure their design objectives are understood, translated into action and that their voices are heard.
Translates opportunities into concepts and concepts into designs.
Provides clear hand offs of designs to the development team but remains available to help as needed throughout development process.
Coordinates and facilitates collaborative design workshops at frequent intervals.
Gets and stays educated about LED technology and other relevant innovation (materials, processes, etc.).
Uses knowledge of design and materials to create multiple concepts, producing several designs in parallel to provide development options.
Ensures concepts, design and process fit within Schoolhouse brand and production/supply chain capabilities to deliver supportable and scalable concepts.
Responsible for the collaborative product design and development process and bringing original and strategic product ideas to conversations focused on the long-term product roadmap.
Adheres to calendars, timelines, and life-cycle documentation to ensure project updates are provided regularly and development milestones are reached on schedule. Provide alternative timeline scenarios when produces require further development.
Conducts research of customer needs, external markets and internal product metrics to steer decisions about the design direction, price point and product requirements of new products.
Produces sketches, technical drawings, models and specifications for new products based on ongoing direction and feedback from Product, Creative Services, NPI and vendor partners.
Managers product documentation including component status tracking and new product introduction hand-off documents.
Responsible for timely progress updates with New Product Introduction as they source new components from domestic and overseas vendor partners, negotiate costing and order quantities for new components/products and build new product prototypes.
Manages PIM software, Margin Worksheets and other tracking documentation for all assigned new products.
Partners with New Product Introduction Operations and Marketing/Phot teams to track progress of photo samples and production inventory.
Facilitates the Product team functions of the First Article Inspection, Quality Control and Pilot Run processes. Successful facilitation includes using best judgement to make calls about product quality and suitability, documenting and transmitting feedback to the team and driving internal and vendor-facing documentation and communication when necessary.
Researches, selects and brings to market brand-appropriate merchandise from wholesale brands and 3rd party makers/manufacturers.
Presents product development work and conduct meeting facilitation of product specific details.

Additional Functions:

Organizes and maintains Lab space used for modeling, prototyping and storage of parts library and reference samples.
Organizes and maintains Product storage areas including Photo Studio storage, basement storage and Product Area storage.
Coordinates samples and prototypes for product reviews, trainings and presentations.
Special projects within and beyond lighting as assigned.

Competencies:

Teamwork - Be trustworthy, treat others with respect, help others learn, ask for help and don't toss blame -we are all in this together.
Communication - Be timely in relaying information or getting answers.
Change - Be nimble, never cynical. Embrace constant change.
Judgement - Make sure to include the right people in the right conversations. Know the system before changing the system.
Time Management - Be at work when you are at work. Use your time wisely and efficiently.
Skills -Always look for ways to grow and improve. Share your knowledge freely and empower others.
Innovation - Continually review systems suggesting ways and tools to improve.
Self-Review - Be 1% better every day.
Qualifications

Qualifications & Requirements:

Degree in Product Design, Industrial Design or similar field
3 to 5 years in a lighting design role
Knowledge of materials and the ability to quickly understand production capabilities of Schoolhouse.
Strong understanding of construction techniques, technologies, and materials common to home goods.
Experience with complex multi-component product developments. Lightening, furniture, bedding, table-top and general home accessories experience a plus.
Demonstrate interest in how customers choose and use our products.
Drawing skills including quick, iterative sketching and detailed technical drawings. Able to use drawings, 3D models and computer designs to express creative ideas, as well as physical prototyping/modeling skills.
Solid communication, planning, facilitation and organizing skills.
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment, includes the ability to lead and contribute to design workshops and assortment planning sessions and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of the organization.
Self-motivated, humble, and nimble.
Impeccably organized and detail oriented.
Able to work within deadlines and budgets.
Eagerness and understanding of what it means to join a fast-growing brand.

Physical Requirements:

Computer use as needed
Ability to occasionally lift up to 20lbs.
Ability to climb and balance atop a ladder
Use of hand and power tools as needed
Ability to travel when needed.

How would you like to use your time and talents to help LegitScript make the internet and payment ecosystems safer and more transparent? At LegitScript, you can do that and also work for one of the Top 100 Workplaces in Oregon.

Join the Engineering Team responsible for creating solutions rooting out fraudulent eCommerce

This engineering team focuses on building the internal and external facing tools and services that support the company’s core mission. This includes automated data analysis tools that enable our researchers to quickly and effectively identify fraudulent activity. We also build public facing web applications and APIs that allow our customers to manage their portfolios of eCommerce merchants and take action on one we find to be fraudulent or high risk.

As a Senior Software Engineer at LegitScript you will:
Design and build scalable solutions that support secure and efficient exchange of large volumes of customer data
Collaborate with other technical leaders to pragmatically evolve existing systems where possible and construct entirely new systems and services when necessary.
Find innovative ways to frequently deliver incremental business value
Provide technical leadership and mentoring to other engineers
Have a lot of fun while making a difference in the world by enabling a safer internet for everyone
Do what you love as an engineer

To be successful in this role you will:
Have more than 4 years of relevant experience with web application development at scale
Have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, a related science discipline, or equivalent industry experience.
Be highly competent with at least one Object Oriented language such as TypeScript, Java or C#
Reflexively apply SOLID programming principles
Speak to and demonstrate the value of automated unit and integration testing
Enjoy solving problems large and small, esoteric and mundane
Strive to become one of the top individual contributors on a Scrum team delivering software solutions and systems into cloud-hosted infrastructures in node.js using TypeScript
Already be confident working in the AWS ecosystem or be driven to quickly learn
Know how to design and develop effective RESTful APIs for internal and external use
Excited about the opportunity to refactor production code akin to changing the engine on a plane in flight
About LegitScript:

LegitScript helps our clients keep their services legal and safe for consumers. Our analysts monitor high-risk online activity to empower businesses, governments, and consumers to make incremental changes that will result in a secure, more transparent internet. This position will be remote until the shelter in place restrictions are lifted.

In addition to competitive salaries, full-time employees enjoy a great benefits package:
United Health Care medical plan with a low cost premium option for individual coverage.
Flexible spending account with employer contributions for commuting expenses (including downtown parking)
Voluntary Dental and Vision plans
401k with company match and immediate vesting
3.5 weeks of PTO in the first year of employment, 4 weeks in the second year, and 4.2 weeks in the third year.
9 paid holidays
Annual Tenure Rewards including Sabbaticals
Candidates must be authorized to work in the US. LegitScript does not offer visa sponsorship at this time. LegitScript is an Equal Opportunity Employer that abides by federal and state laws that prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation or national origin; or their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities.

Senior DevOps Engineer (Azure)
Beaverton, OR, USA
Employees can work remotely
Full-time
Company Description
At Anitian we believe security can be a force for good. As such, we are on a mission to make security and compliance easy for all. We harness the power and scale of the cloud to empower developers with automated, accelerated, autonomous, and accommodating security technologies.

Anitian is a place where smart people get to be smart. When you join our team, you will enjoy a workplace of creative problem solvers who cherish intelligence, compassion, and boldness. You will also enjoy the immediate respect of industry peers, as Anitian is recognized as a thought leader in information security.

COVID-19 Notice: During the pandemic, Anitian is conducting all interviews online with video conference technology. New employees are being onboarded virtually and provided the tools they need to begin employment working remote from home.

This position will remain fully remote.
Job Description
We are seeking a Senior DevOps Engineer to help lead the effort to build our Compliance Automation product in Microsoft Azure. Essentially, this is a ‘port’ of our existing flagship product in AWS rewritten to work in Azure.

Responsibilities

This position will work with our Principal DevOps Architect to ensure the product meets requirements and matches feature parity as closely as possible with our existing AWS offering. This position will primarily be responsible for writing Terraform code to create and manage Azure resources (Virtual Networks, Virtual Machines, Firewall Rules, etc.).

Expectations
Develop, test, deploy, and optimize IAC code (Terraform)
Develop, test, deploy, and optimize Configuration Management code (Ansible)
Develop and configure Test Automation solutions (Chef Inspec)
Configuration and management of Azure services
Provisioning automation using CI/CD and IaC tools
Understanding of security principals and compliance frameworks
Automate the deployment, configuration, and management of complex cloud environments
Work with MSSP analysts to troubleshoot and analyze incidents

Qualifications
Experience
4+ years working with CI/CD pipelines (build, deploy, test)
3+ years working in Azure architecture, configuration, and management
2+ year test automation development
Experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible, Puppet, or Chef
Experience with shell scripting (Bash, PowerShell)
Experience with interpreted languages such as Ruby or Python
Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools such as Terraform, ARM templates, etc
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Deep knowledge of Linux distros: deployment, management, and security
SQL DB configuration and management
Understanding of security data and controls
Strong understanding of DevOps and Agile methodologies
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal
Ability to work directly with clients, troubleshoot issues, and work toward a solution
Other Beneficial Skills:
Experience with Splunk or any other SIEM product
Familiarity with additional Azure services (Virtual Networks, Directory Services, etc…)
Experience with GitLab, and the Atlassian stack

Additional Information
Benefits of this position include:
Fully remote position (USA)
Competitive compensation package
Four weeks of PTO per year with rollover allowance
Eleven paid holidays
Generous benefit package includes 100% paid health care premium and vision for the employee and dental benefits
Employer paid Life insurance, Long term and Short Term Disability
401K retirement plan, up to 4% matching after a year of service
Educational / professional development reimbursement program
Other Information
Candidates must pass a criminal background check and reference check before being hired.
Sponsorship for work visas are not available for this position
Recruiters, do not contact us about this job

Senior Software Engineer, Mobile (ReactNative – iOS/Android)

Healthcare workers are our heroes. Our easy to use COVID-19 screening tools, as well as Remote Patient Monitoring and Patient Engagement platform enable healthcare workers to extend their capacity remotely and safely. At the heart of this platform are our engineers who build the tools and technology-enabled experiences that help healthcare providers to better manage the needs of their patients.

Do you want to join in the fight against COVID-19? We're hiring experienced software engineers who are looking for new challenges at a fast-growing, digital health startup. You’ll have a direct impact on the optimize.health platform and will be quickly given ownership of a large part of our codebase. You'll be focused on building user-facing mobile apps and mobile web applications that interface with hardware sensors via Bluetooth technology, as well as building out other patient-specific mobile experiences.

You must have experience working on an agile software team that has developed and shipped software to users. You must have a natural product intuition, work harder, faster and smarter without sacrificing technical excellence. As a mobile software engineer, you will have direct impact on our mobile applications. You will work alongside other engineers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design and creation of quality products is essential to be successful in this role.

Here is what an ideal candidate looks like to us:
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or other relevant discipline
In lieu of a formal “degreed” education, an equivalent combination of experience would meet this requirement
At least 3 years of experience building scalable mobile applications
Preference given for a great demo or portfolio of past work
Must have Skills
3 years professional software development experience developing on mobile devices (iOS/Android).
Solid grasp of ReactNative, JavaScript and ECMAScript.
Experience with the Bluetooth stack on iOS/Android.
iOS/Android testing and debugging.
Familiarity with offline storage, threading and performance tuning
Knowledge of RESTful APIs to connect to back-end services
Solid understanding of Apple (& Google/Android) design principles and interface guidelines
Knack for benchmarking and optimization
Proficient with continuous integration and code versioning tools (Git)
Familiarity with cloud messaging APIs and push notifications
Understanding of the Apple AppStore & Google Play store publishing process and nuances.
Bonus Points For
Sharing your GitHub account or other public code repository
Advanced knowledge of CSS (as well as CSS preprocessing)
Advanced knowledge of iOS and Android Developer Tools
Experience with mobile performance testing
Continuous integration e.g. CircleCI
About you:
Fast Learner
You should be able to adapt quickly to meet the needs of our growing business environment.
You must have advanced knowledge of mobile architecture.
You’ve been challenged in the past and proved you were capable meeting those challenges.
Fearlessness
You think a working proof of concept is the best way to make a point.
You strive on proving that speed and quality have absolutely no conflicts, so you take the leap to wow us at every opportunity.
Strong Technical Chops and Passion for Your Work.
Staying on top of the latest software architectural trends is your passion.
You enjoy writing code and would spend hours doing so, even if you weren’t getting paid…we’ll still pay you though.
Startup Culture
We work hard and when celebration is due, we play hard, of course!
You must be a team player while also being comfortable taking initiative and speaking up if you see a better way to solve a problem.
You’re excited by the idea that nothing is holding you back at optimize.health. If you can execute on a better idea, then you’ll be encouraged to do so.
Working on a small team is appealing to you, as is the idea of growing that team larger.
Appreciates Good Design; Focused On Delighting The User
At optimize.health, we wear various hats, but one common quality we all possess is an eye for good design.
You must understand requirements beyond the written word.
Whatever you work on, you should bring an attention to detail with the end goal of producing a product that will elicit customer delight.

Role description


Our Data Platform team at Unity empowers teams across our AI@Unity department to leverage the terabytes of data our company ingests, processes, and builds infrastructure around to do their best work. From simulations to asset store recommendations to in-editor personalization, we create the foundation that allows other teams at Unity to create best in class services and tools for Unity users.

As a Senior Engineer with us, you can expect to partner closely with other engineers, product specialists, and data experts to research, prototype, and develop world-class data applications, services, and pipelines around our more than 60 billion daily data events!

Responsibilities
Design, develop, own, and operate a world-class large-scale data platform
Contribute to the architecture and development of large-scale distributed systems
Collaborate cross-functionally to identify opportunities across Unity for data-driven solutions
Champion development best practices that ensure quality and velocity within the team
Develop Machine Learning infrastructure systems
Requirements
Expertise in Scala, Python, Go, C#, or Java
Extensive experience in building performant, robust, large scale data/distributed systems
Extensive experience with a major cloud service provider such as GCP AWS, and Azure
Superb communication skills
Significant experience with large scale data systems and related technologies
Significant experience in architecting data solutions
Bonus Points
Experience with deep learning or machine learning
Who we are

Unity is the creator of the world’s leading real-time 3D development platform, giving users the most powerful and accessible tools to create, operate, and monetize experiences for the real-time world. Unity empowers anyone, regardless of skill level and industry, to create 3D visual content using world-class technology, operate using resources that maximize ease-of-use, and monetize, so that they can find success with their creations.

The company’s 1,000 person development team keeps Unity at the forefront of development by working alongside partners such as Google, Oculus, Autodesk, Microsoft and many more, to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Made with Unity experiences reach nearly 3 billion devices worldwide and have been installed more than 34 billion times in the last 12 months. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

Position Summary:

The Drive Flex team is seeking a Front-End engineer to help take our premier SaaS-based Dealer Management Solution (DMS) to the next level. It's built using React on the Front-End complimented by a micro-services architecture on the back-end built on Java running in containers on AWS. POSITION CAN BE BASED IN PORTLAND/SAN JOSE/AUSTIN

Overall Responsibilities:
Participate in the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) developing new features and functionalities for large-scale enterprise software solutions, encompassing service layers, integration, user interfaces, and data.

Senior DevOps Engineer
If you are a Senior DevOps Engineer with Azure experience, please read on!

Location: Remote (We're in Plano, TX)
Salary: $110,000 - $125,000
Full Time/Direct Hire

We are a diverse team that wears many hats with a primary role to keep our products and websites online and running. While developers are focusing on completing features and meeting feature requirements, the DevOps team is focusing on the underlying technologies to support those features and the plan to scale the application and to make it resilient to system failures. Besides making things work and keeping things running, we also build and manage several large internal services including automating repetitive tasks and finding ways to improve our systems. We improve our monitoring and metrics gathering so that we can detect issues earlier and handle them before any customers are impacted. We are looking for a candidate who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is interested in a rapidly growing company.
What You Need for this Position
- Knowledge and experience with Linux and managing Linux and Linux/Windows hybrid environments.

- Experience managing infrastructure as code with tools like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform, and Cloud Formation.

- Experience with and knowledge of CI/CD tools like Jenkins and/or Gitlab CI.

-Experience writing software using a modern high level language like Python, Ruby, PHP, C#, etc.

Experience writing software that utilizes 3rd party APIs.

- Experience working with an RDBMS like MySQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL, etc.

- An understanding of TCP/IP networking.
So, if you are a Senior DevOps Engineer with experience, please apply today! or send your resume to: erinn@cybercoders.com

eBay is a global commerce leader that allows you to shape how the world buys, sells, and gives. You’ll be part of a work culture that’s been genuinely committed to diversity and inclusion since its founding more than 20 years ago. Here, you can just be yourself, do your best work, and have a meaningful impact on people across the globe. We are looking for people with drive, ideas, and a passion for helping small businesses succeed to help shape the future of eBay—does this sound like you? If so, we’d love to talk to you!

About Our Team:

Are you passionate about databases? Are you addicted to solving complex problems at incredible scale? We need an outstanding Software Engineer to join our team in Rancho Cordova. We are responsible for everything data-related at eBay, from the end-user APIs all the way down the stack to actually building databases themselves!

You should have a love for using - and crafting - newest technology. You, with your solid understanding of computer science fundamentals, your experience with data infrastructure and passion to innovate, will join us on our multi-year journey to transform our data ecosystem to a cloud-native platform while keeping the existing stacks operating faster and more reliable than ever before.

It’s essential that you will have strong software development experiences across a breadth of data platforms, including relational SQL, NoSQL, and Key-Value stores. Your knowledge of distributed systems is a strength. You are encouraged to be results-oriented, produce high quality work and be comfortable working with senior management. You will identify problems that need solving and will be empowered to solve them.

This is a true software engineering position, not an administrator or sysop role.

Primary job Responsibilities:
Build and support data services, client APIs and back-end databases.
Maintain and improve existing data platform
Full life cycle ownership of our products from design through implementation, to production support.
Join Scrum team and attend daily project stand-up meetings.
Be a domain specialist on data products
Participate in and lead cross-team and cross-geography projects
Responsible for software process: design, user documentation, code review.

Job Requirements:
BS or higher in Computer Science, CIS, EE, or related field
6+ years of experience in requirements analysis, design, coding and unit testing of scalable, distributed, fault-tolerant applications
Mandatory Skill: Java, C++ is a plus
Participate in all phases of the software development lifecycle, including discovery, analysis, requirements definition, solution design, configuration, code development, testing, deployment and support
Expertise required in object-oriented design methodology and application development in Java and J2EE, including Spring, Hibernate, servlets, JDBC, XML, XSL
Expertise in unit test, code coverage process, pipeline setup.
Experience with database and SQL, preferably Oracle
Working knowledge of NoSQL and Key-Value databases
Test Driven development
Proven track of success with strong focus on high velocity and high quality
Familiar with Agile/Scrum
Strong "soft" interpersonal skills
